loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet Timwine is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single with one child who is not currently in school. Annet has a retail shop, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Annet hopes to expand her business. She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by getting more capital from her business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar for sale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:

Lydia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving on her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and other materials.

loans.name: Mi Nuevo Desarrollo Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Mi Nuevo Desarrollo está integrado por seis socias, las cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas en la comunidad. La coordinadora del grupo es la sra. María Ana T. Matute, ella tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la ciudad de Juticalpa, Olancho.  María Ana se dedica a la venta ambulante de productos de uso personal y cosméticos, ella trabaja 4 horas al día ya que padece del Colon y de Soplo en el corazón y eso le impide emplear más horas de trabajo diario. Su ventaja es que los productos que ofrece se venden muy rápido, ya que a las mujeres siempre les gusta verse muy bonitas y su dificultad es que vende al crédito y en ocasiones sus clientas le quedan mal con el pago. Su sueño es tener algunos empleados para aumentar su área de ventas y obtener más ingresos. Ella solicita el financiamiento para comprar perfumes, cremas, shampoos, acondicionadores, listicks, sombras de ojos, rímel, desodorantes, etc, ya que en esta época del año sus proveedores tienen muchas promociones y quiere aprovecharlas. Tiene varios ciclos en FAMA y está  muy agradecida con el apoyo que ha recibido porque su negocio le ha permitido suplir sus necesidades más básicas.
texts.en:
The Mi Nuevo Desarollo community bank has 6 members that have different businesses in the community. The group's coordinator is Maria Ana T. Matute, who is 55 married with 6 children and lives with her family in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho. 

Maria Ana makes a living selling cosmetics and related products door to door. She only works 4 hours daily since she has colon problems and a heart murmur and those keeps her from working longer. Her advantage is that the products she sells move quickly since women always like to look nice. A disadvantage is that she sells on credit and sometimes her customers don't pay on time. 

Her dream is to have a few employees to expand her sales territory and increase her income. She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, creams, shampoos, conditioners, lipsticks, eye shadow, mascara, deodorants, etc, since this time of year her suppliers have great deals and she wants to take advantage of them. 

She has had several loans with FAMA and is very thankful for the support since her business has allowed her to meet her basic needs.

loans.use: Purchase deodorants, creams, shampoos, conditioners, cosmetics

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es:
Rafael Ángel es un buen miembro de familia de 70 años que vive en “El por Fin”, un barrio de comerciantes, vendedores ambulantes y de mucha solidaridad comunitaria, ubicado en el sur occidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla, tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 30 a 40 años y con su cónyuge sueña con su prosperidad y en especial ver  terminar sus estudios a su hijo menor.
En el año 1994 el hermano  de Rafael, le regaló  un enfriador de su propiedad, envases de gaseosas y cerveza que no utilizaba y logró que la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo le otorgara un crédito por valor de $300.000 COP, que le sirvieron para comprar 3 juegos de mesas  con sus respectivas sillas, 10 cajas de cervezas y 5 de gaseosas, así fue como iniciò su negocio y durante 16 años ha estado recibiendo inyecciones de capital de trabajo y  formación empresarial por parte de esta organización; con su esfuerzo y disciplina de trabajo  ha logrado atender las necesidades de su hogar y agregar un tipo de negocio diferente: el de vender mercancías como ropa. Hoy está solicitando su credikiva para proveerse de gaseosas y cervezas en un buen volumen, comprar pantalones jeans para hombres, pues lo espera una época de repunte en sus ventas, por las fiestas navideñas y de año nuevo que se avecinan, con esta inyección de capital de trabajo confia en obtener utilidades para reparar su kiosco y lograr que su hijo menor termine de estudiar.
El año pasado tuvo un gran desafío y fuè la recuperación de su cartera, pero hoy es mucho más controlado para otorgar créditos y saber a quiénes le da esa opción, pues su mayor parte de la venta la hace de contado.
texts.en:
Rafael Angel is 70 year-old family man who lives in "El por Fin," a neighborhood of traders and street sellers with a lot of community solidarity, located in the southwestern part of the city of Barranquilla.  He has 4 children who are all 30-40 years old.  With his wife, he dreams of prosperity and especially of seeing his youngest son complete his education.

In the year 1994, his brother gave him a cooler from his property, and bottles of soft drinks and beer that he wasn't using, and Rafael managed to get a $300,000 COP loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which he used to buy 3 sets of tables and chairs, 10 cases of beer, and 5 cases of soft drinks.  In this way he started his business, and over the past 16 years he has been receiving injections of working capital and business training from this organization.  With effort and disciplined work, he has managed to meet the household needs and add another type of business: selling merchandise such as clothing.  Today he is requesting a Kiva loan to supply his business with soft drinks and beer in large volume and to buy men's jeans, as he is awaiting the season when sales tend to rebound during the season of Christmas and New Year's that lie ahead.  With this injection of working capital he trusts that he will obtain the profits that he needs to repair his kiosk and allow his youngest child to finish his studies.

Last year he faced a great challenge in repairing his finances, but today everything is much more under control in terms of who he provides credit to, and he is making the majority of his sales on a cash basis.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and beer in large volume, and to buy men's jeans

loans.name: Gladys Esther

texts.es:
La alegre expresión de Gladys  N. es una muestra de la manera como vive su vida, entre las comunicaciones físicas y virtuales, pues ella tiene e justamente un negocio llamado “Comunicaciones Gladys, donde ofrece servicios de internet, fotocopiado, llamada y como ha logrado un mercado estable, también se las ingenió para vender mercancías variadas.  Ella es una mujer viuda que vive en el barrio Santa Elena de Barranquilla y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 29 a 33 años, e inició su vida empresarial con un negocio de confección una vez falleció su esposo, y quedó sola encargada del sostenimiento de su familia, lo cual  antes no lo hacía.  Con este negocio inicial, llegó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en un grupo solidario de 4 integrantes, gradualmente su crecimiento fue tan  notorio que debió independizarse,  pero decidió emprender un negocio de comunicaciones , que es el que actualmente  tiene, pues  es una de las aptitudes que la caracteriza; hoy cuenta con 6 equipos de cómputos  e impresora y ya tiene 20 créditos con esta organización, con la cual ha logrado ofrecer estudios a sus hijos y aumentar su calidad de vida familiar;  es notorio el mejoramiento de su vivienda y la autosuficiencia de Gladys acompañada con un buen comportamiento de pago de sus obligaciones, lo que la hacen merecedora de  la confianza de muchas instituciones que se le acercan.
En la actualidad  está solicitando su credikiva para   renovar sus equipos y prepararse para la temporada de vacaciones de los estudiantes, que muy pronto se avecina,  y sus equipos deben estar a toda marcha.  Su sueño es adecuar su   casa construyendo su segundo piso para separar el negocio totalmente,  tener una miscelánea donde vender sus mercancías y más adelante un carro propio donde pasear con su familia, tal como  como se lo merecen después de muchos años de esfuerzo y este es justamente su gran desafío.
texts.en:
Gladys N.'s cheerful expression is a sign of the way in which she lives her life in physical and virtual communications.  She has a business called “Comunicaciones Gladys” where she offers Internet, photocopying and 'phone services.  As she has achieved a stable market, she has also managed to start selling a variety of goods.  She is a widow who lives in the Santa Elena de Barranquilla neighborhood and has 3 children aged from 29 to 33 years old.  She began her business career with a dressmaking business after her husband died and she found herself alone and in charge of supporting her family, something which she didn't do before.  She arrived at the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with this initial business as part of a communal bank made up of four members.  Gradually her growth became so great that she decided to go it alone, setting up a communications business which is the one she currently has since it is one of the talents for which she is well known.  She currently has 6 computer systems and printer. She has already had 20 loans from this organization which have enabled her to provide an education for her children and improve her family's quality of life.  The improvements to her home and Gladys' self-sufficiency are well known as is her good repayment history which makes her worthy of the trust of the many institutions which approach her.

Gladys is currently requesting a Kiva loan to update her equipment and get ready for the student holiday period which is fast approaching. Her equipment needs to be working at full speed. Her dream is to adapt her house by building a second level in order to completely separate her business; to own a general store where she can sell her merchandise and, further in the future, she hopes to buy her own car so that she can go out for a drive with her family which is what they deserve after many years of effort.  This is her biggest goal.

loans.use: To purchase two computer systems

Araba uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of the family expenses. Araba will use the loan to purchase more fish and soap for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to reinvest back into her business.

The picture shows the dried fish she sells.

loans.use: purchase more fish and soap for sale

loans.name: Fustina Esi

texts.en:
Fustina Esi A. A. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Fustina is a fish seller at Abura, which she has done for some time now. Her husband is a second-hand clothing trader.  She uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Fustina will use the loan to purchase more fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fustian Esi A. plans to put aside savings. 

The picture shows Fustina with her smoked fish.

loans.use: purchase more fish for sale

loans.name: Ekua Wagara Comfort

texts.en:
Ekua Wagara Comfort A. sells fish at Abura.  Ekua Wagara Comfort has received junior high school.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer.  She has been selling fish some time now. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business for future use.

The picture shows Ekua with the smoked fish she sells.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Yaa Kwaa Gladys

texts.en:
Yaa Kwaa Gladys M. sells 'Fante kenkey' (fermented corn dough, a staple food) and serves it with fried fish and pepper sauce at Abura. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa has been in this trade for some time now. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan will be added to her initial capital to help her expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop to sell provisions.

She has displayed to the left of her table with a few "Fante kenkey"s for sale.

loans.use: add to her initial capital

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet Y. is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. She has received junior high education.  Janet prepares 'banku' (a dish made from corn) at Abura. She uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. She will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare 'banku' for sale. Janet plans to educate her children with the additional income that may result from the loan.

In this picture Janet is displaying what she uses to prepare the 'banku'. At the time this picture was taken, Janet had closed for the day.

loans.use: purchase more maize to prepare 'banku' for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary T. is a widow taking care of four children. She has been through junior high school. Mary sells cooked rice at Abura. Mary uses her income to feed, clothe and educate her children. The loan is going to serve as an additional capital to extend her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to further her children’s education.

loans.use: additional capital to extend her business

loans.name: Maame Yaa Asieduwah Catherine

texts.en:
Maame Yaa Asieduwah Catherine Y. is single and has junior high education. Maame bakes pastries at Abura for sale and distribution. She will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to expand the quantities she can bake. Maame plans to reinvest the profit back into her business.

In this photo, Maame had already dispatched the pastries she had baked for the morning.

loans.use: purchase more ingredients so she can bake larger quantities

loans.name: Ama Gladys

texts.en:
Ama Gladys G. W. is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Ama processes 'gari' for sale at Abura. She will use the loan to purchase large quantities of cassava to process for resale. Ama assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to build a house.

'Gari' is made from cassava. In this picture Ama is standing behind the machine used to grind the cassava.

loans.use: purchase large quantities of cassava to process for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. is married and has a child. Her husband is a farmer. She has been through junior high school. Mary sells fruit at Abura. Mary is asking for the loan to purchase a variety of fruits for sale. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. With the new profits from her extended business, Mary plans to complete her building.

loans.use: purchase a variety of fruits for sale

loans.name: Yaa Fosuwa Dorcas

texts.en: Yaa Fosuwa Dorcas A. is a hairdresser at Abura. Yaa has junior high educational background. She is single and has been a hairdresser for three years. Her loan will be used to buy hair creams and other hair products for her customers' hair. She hopes to buy an additional hair dryer from her additional profit.

loans.use: buy hair creams and other hair products

loans.name: Florence Yaa Komaa

texts.en:
Florence Yaa Komaa A. sells plastic bowls at Abura. She is married and has six dependents.  Her husband is a farmer. Florence has not received any formal education. She assists her husband in taking care of the family. The loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls to expand her business.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land.

Displayed in the picture are some of the plastic products she sells.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls to expand her business.

loans.name: Ana Nyame Inkom

texts.en:
Ana Nyame Inkom D. produces palm oil at Abura. She is married and lives together with her nine dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the welfare of the home. The loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to prepare oil for sale. She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

In this picture Ana is getting her palm fruit ready for oil-making.

loans.use: buy more palm fruit to prepare oil for sale

loans.name: Hagar Esi Nyarkoa

texts.en:
Hagar Esi Nyarkoa Y. is married and has six dependents. Hagar buys cocoa and resells it at Abura. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Hagar will use the loan to purchase more cocoa for sale.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Hagar plans to reinvest back into her business.

In the bowl is a sample of the cocoa seeds sent to be sold.

loans.use: purchase more cocoa for sale

loans.name: Georgina Adjoa Kyerebia

texts.en:
Georgina Adjoa Kyerebia A. is divorced and has two children. She has received junior high education. Georgina sells 'wakye' (beans and rice cooked together) at Abura. She will use the loan to purchase more rice and beans to cook for sale. She plans to build a shop for her business from the additional income.

The picture shows Georgina selling her cooked 'waakye'.

loans.use: purchase more rice and beans to cook for sale

loans.name: Mary Yaa Nkrumah

texts.en:
Mary Yaa Nkrumah A. extracts palm oil for sale at Abura.  Mary has received junior high education.  She is a widow and has six dependents. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruit to process into oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

The picture shows Mary with the palm fruits she is going to use for the preparation of the oil.

loans.use: buy more palm fruit to process into oil

loans.name: Gaburira Bakyara Twetungure, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
Hard-work and the social nature of A. Herode has seen him operate a thriving business handling an alcohol and soda sales business in Ikona, Ntungamo. The married, father of 4 children has been running this business for the past 15 years and earns 300,000 Ugandan shillings a week. 
His current setback is having little capital to purchase business inputs including stock of beers and soft drinks. This loan will help him to revive his business in terms of expansion and will also enable him to earn more revenue for his family's needs and his children's education.

He belongs to Gaburira Bakyara Twetungure group which insures and hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Concerned Mothers Group - Kampala

texts.en:
Lillian K. belongs to the Concerned Mothers Group - Kampala. She is 39 years old and has four kids. It is now exactly one year ago that she embarked on her hardware-selling business in Zzana. With 960,000 shillings as monthly profits in this short period of time, the prospects of her achieving even better success are on the horizon, she happily divulges. With this kind of upbeat optimism, no one can go wrong in any aspect of life.  

From the perspective of business, Lillian has, in the course of time, been brought to terms with the fact that this pays dividends. The need for money to support herself and her family was the motivation for starting this business. Earlier, she was plying a clothes-selling business that she says laid the foundation for her in starting up this business. With this loan, she says she is going to increase her hardware stock for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more hardware stock for resale

loans.name: Success Development Initiative Group - Mityana

texts.en:
Madrine N. is a young, suave and ambitious 26-year-old pub operator. She says all bets are off as to whether her chances of success are in the ascendant. The self-confidence she exudes is typical of somebody who has success in their grasp. She set forth in this business four years ago with a firm sense of conviction that this business would be a sustainable and dependable means of subsistence. She has not lived a single day of regret as this business has been a means to an end in her dream to extricate herself out of narrow circumstances. All the while, she was a teacher who lived by wits.

She is a mother of four who says she is going to purchase more crates of both hard and soft drinks for her pub with this loan. She is part of the Success Development Group - Mityana.

loans.use: The purchase of more crates of both hard and soft drinks for her pub

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is a 54-year-old widowed mother of six who operates a drug pharmacy in Bukoloto-Kayunga. She has been selling drugs for the last 10 years. The fact that she is a trained nurse has been an advantage in that the prescription of drugs has not posed any kind of hitch to her. Her business accrues 200,000 shillings monthly. 

Christine describes herself as fully focused and steadfast, especially with the plans to elevate the status of her business and family. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more drugs for resale at her pharmacy.

loans.use: The purchase of more drugs for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of more metallic material for welding

loans.name: Kiri Ewala Savings Group-Kampala

texts.en: K. Harriet belongs to Kiri Ewala Savings group-Kampala. 20 years is the time she has been manifesting good customer relationship skills and hard work in her soft drinks and electronics business in Katwe-Kampala. These have been essential and cardinal in winning her a client base and establishing for her a vantage place in the local market. 100,000 shillings is what accrues to her business weekly as profits. Harriet says her husband, with whom she has 11 kids, was a tower of strength in helping her get established. With this loan, she says she is going to revamp her F.K. Grocery store business by purchasing more crates of soft drinks and electronics. She also says some of the proceeds will go into paying fees for her kids.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of soft drinks to sell to pay school fees for her kids

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
The produce sale business is very active with many small entities here in Uganda. This is where one S. Jackson has banked his savings to earn more profit. The married father of 4 children started up a grocery and produce store dealing in fresh foods like, sweet potatoes, beans,maize and other agro produce 15 years ago in Myeri, Kyenjojo. Due to his hard work and determination, he has been able to run this business and it earns him 720,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. 

With this loan he is looking forward to restocking the business with more maize and beans which will make him in the market. He envisions expanding his business into whole sale and this will attract many more customers to his shop. Earning more revenue and making the business expand is his main motive. He looks forward to educating his children.

loans.use: purchase more stock for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph K. from the  Nyamirima trading centre of Bushenyi is a hard working and determined agriculturalist who has been running a produce business for over 4 years. He sells food items and makes coffee sales. His hard work and friendly character have brought him far.  Along with his other business of farming, the businesses, together, earn him 300,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. 

This loan will help him provide a better quality of products like, coffee, beans, maize and  restock his business to meet the customers demand. With an improved business he will be able to earn more revenue and be able to better support his family in the future as he struggles to educate his 5 children to make them better people in the future.

loans.use: purchase produce for sale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine N. has been a poultry farmer for close to 8 years now. This is, by every measure, a lucrative and dependable means of earning a livelihood in many of Uganda's urban centers, where the consumption of chicken is growing by the day. The location of her business is in Kangulumira-Kayunga. This mother of 7 says her monthly cash returns are to the tune of shillings 5 million.  The rental business she also operates has been momentous in helping her consolidate her profits. Before she embarked on any of the above she was selling garments. With this loan she says she is going to buy more young chicks.

loans.use: To purchase more young chicks.

loans.name: Butungisa Bakyara Twimukye Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
There is a fascinating story behind the determined Emmanuel M.  who is not afraid of diversity in business. This hard working married father of 10 children ventured into the agro produce and retail business 8 years ago dealing in general food crops like; bananas, beans, maize flour, ground nuts, peas and products like; salt, and sugar from his retail shop in Rwemiyaga cell Ntungamo. Due to his pressing need to educate his children, he began this business with his personal savings and food supplies from his gardens to supplement family incomes by earning sales revenue.

With this loan, Emmanuel will be able to purchase more stock and be able to improve his earnings. He looks forward to a self sustaining life through educating his children and improving the house hold income.
		
Emmanuel belongs to Butungisa Bakyara Twimukye group in Ntungamo.

loans.use: purchase of more stock for the shop

loans.name: Abateesa Kabowa-Kampala Group

texts.en:
60 year old Nadima N. belongs to  the Abateesa Kabowa group-Kampala. She is happily married with 16 kids. Yes! 16 kids who she profoundly takes pride in. Retailing is her business preoccupation. She values it highly because with earnings from it, she has sustained her family through thick and thin. How long has she been in this business? She says "30 years". Yes! 30 years. This is a long drawn out time that she says has called for perseverance, tenacity, painstaking planning and above all prayer. N. is widowed but she has gone to every length to give her kids an education and other necessities even in the face of adversity. She has seen most of her kids through school with profits from this business. She also sells milk.

 With this loan, she is going to purchase more baby powder products and calculators as these are in high demand.

loans.use: The purchase of more baby powder products and calculators

loans.name: Basooka Kwavula Development Group-Kayunga

texts.en: With diligence and painstaking plans, all bets are off regarding the success of any business. Success will only be in one’s grasp if the above is adhered to. For 68 year old Livingstone K.  whose affiliation is with Basooka Kwavula Development Association-Kayunga, this resonates deeply He has been building on his success at the helm of his farming business in Kisaaba for 20 years. Through these years he has come to grips with the fact that there is always a silver lining, even in the most difficult of situations, whilst operating a business.  He has managed to strike a balance through the chequered experiences of business. Livingstone plants cash crops that he sells after harvesting. In a month his business generates him  260,000 shillings. With this loan he wants to buy more seeds of other crops like pumpkins, cabbage, coffee, etc that he plans on plant and later, after harvesting, to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of pumpkin, cabbage and coffee seeds for his plantation.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: bgrrhtujkrtghh
texts.en: bgrrhtujkrtghh

loans.use: to buy new tools

loans.name: La Merced (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal La Merced esta formada por 10 mujeres quienes viven en la parroquia de Santa Ana,  sus actividades más importantes son la agricultura, la ganadería y pequeños huertos frutales, estos productos son para el autoconsumo, lo poco que resta se comercializa en la ciudad de Cuenca. Otros habitantes salen por las mañanas a trabajar en la ciudad de Cuenca y retornan por las tardes a sus hogares. Nuestras socias son mujeres quienes trabajan día a día con una sonrisa en los labios y le ven en cada amanecer la mejor oportunidad de superarse y entregar a sus hijos un mejor futuro.

La Señora. María M. vive en la parroquia de Santa Ana, es el noveno crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, beneficiándose con los créditos en su hogar. Se dedica a trabajar como empleada domestica labor que ya lleva 25 años y labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, en su hogar se dedica a la cría de pollos, inició este negocio gracias al primer crédito que  realizo en la banca comunal.
Doña María tiene 49 años, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 30 y 28 años de edad que son casados, uno de sus hijos vive con ella en la casa que han construido en conjunto. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus pollos Su sueño es seguir conservando su salud para continuar con su trabajo.

La Señora. Blanca A. vive por la parroquia del Valle. Tiene 46 años, es divorciada hace 18 años, tiene 4 hijos de 29, 27, 24 y 22 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive  independiente, su segundo hijo está en la casa con proyecto de ponerse un negocio y sus dos últimos hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña Blanca se dedica a trabajar en un pequeño restaurante que es de su propiedad en el cual  labora hace un año, trabaja todos los días de lunes a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, también en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías o cuando le hacen pedidos sus amigas y familiares. Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su restaurante como: víveres, colas, aguas etc. Su sueño es tener su casa propia
texts.en:
The La Merced communal bank is made up of 10 women who live in the parish of Santa Ana. Their most important activities are in agriculture, keeping livestock and small orchards. What they produce is to sustain themselves and thier families, with a little left over to sell in the city of Cuenca. Others who live there go each morning to work in Cuenca and return home in the evenings. Our members are women who go to work each day with a smile on their lips and who each morning see an opportunity to improve their lot and offer their children a better future.

Señora María M. lives in the parish of Santa Ana. This is her 9th loan with the communal bank, and her household has benefited greatly from the loans. She has worked in domestic service for 25 years, Monday to Friday from 8am till 6pm. At home she raises chickens - a business she started thanks to her first loan with the communal bank. Doña María, age 49, is single and has 2 children, aged 30 and 28, who are both married. One of her children lives with her in the house they built together. The money she borrows will be invested in feed for her chickens. Her dream is to stay in good health and be able to continue working.

Señora Blanca A. lives in the parish of del Valle. She is 46 ears old, has been divorced for 18 years, and has 4 children, aged 29, 27, 24 and 22. Her eldest son is married and living independently, her second son lives at home and is setting up his own business, and her 2 younger children work and help her with the household expenses. She rents, rather than owns her own house. Doña Blanca works in her own small restaurant, which she has had for one year. She works every day Monday to Friday from 7am until 3pm, and her free time is taken up making handicrafts or making up orders from friends and acquaintances. This is her first loan from the communal bank and she is going to invest it in products for her restaurant, such as staple ingredients and soft drinks. Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy chicken-feed, staple foods, soft drinks, and other items

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el sector Bodegones, una zona rural y agrícola del distrito de Lambayeque, se encuentra situada a media hora de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a trabajar en labores agrícolas, el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar menestras y forraje para animales. Cuando ya es temporada de cosecha las suele vender en su mismo terreno a los comerciantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad el trata de sacar adelante a su familia.

Es esta oportunidad Juan ha sembrado frijol y su cultivo ya se encuentra listo para la cosecha. El no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para realizar esta acción, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Juan es una persona bastante trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien honrado y de confianza.
texts.en:
Juan is a 32 year-old father who lives with his wife and their children in the Bodegones neighborhood, a rural farming area in the Lambayeque district, located a half hour from the city of Chiclayo.  

Juan has been working in agriculture for 10 years; he has some land where he often cultivates beans and forage for animals.  When it is time to harvest, he often sells to the traders who come to visit his area.  With the income this provides, he supports his family.

Now Juan is cultivating beans and his crops are ready to harvest.  He lacks sufficient resources to carry out the harvest, and so he is requesting for the first time a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 500 Peruvian soles.

Juan is a hardworking person who has a strong desire to get ahead.  The people who know him consider him to be an honest and trustworthy person.

loans.use: to cover expenses related to the harvesting of his bean crops

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio tiene 60 años de edad, es agricultor y vive con su esposa, su hijo y sus nietos en el sector Sialupe Baca, ubicado en el distrito de Lambayeque, a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado durante casi toda su vida a la agricultura y depende de ella para sostener a su familia, posee un terreno de una hectárea que trabaja junto a su hijo y en el suele sembrar algunos granos y cereales. Durante la presente campaña ha sembrado frijol pallar. En estas actividades el es ayudado por uno de sus hijos y como este es su fuente mas importante de ingresos ellos se encargan de cuidar su cultivo del mejor modo posible.

Emilio ya ha trabajado anteriormente con un préstamo financiado por el Fondo Kiva, en aquella oportunidad el también había sembrado frijol pallar y con el dinero del crédito pudo brindar mantenimiento y obtuvo una buena cosecha. Actualmente el se encuentra solicitando  un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para compra de abono y foliares, también con la finalidad de brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo.

Emilio se encuentra contento y muy agradecido con la ayuda brindada a su negocio a través del programa Kiva. El desea seguir trabajando para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Emilio, 60, is a farmer.  He lives with his wife, his son and his grandchildren in Sialupe Baca, located in Lambayeque district, forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been a farmer his whole life and depends on farming to support his family.  He has a one hectare plot that he farms with his son; he usually plants grains and cereals.  During the current planting season he has planted lima beans.  One of his sons helps him with the work and since this is their most important source of income they care for their crops in the best way possible.

Emilio has had a previous loan financed by Kiva.  On that occasion too he had planted lima beans and the loan funds made it possible for him to provide good crop care and thus a good harvest.  He is now asking for a 1000 new sol loan to buy manure and leaf fertilizers to once again provide good care for his crops.

Emilio is happy and very grateful for the help provided to his business through the Kiva program.  He wants to continue working in order to have his family succeed.

loans.use: To buy manure and leaf fertilizers for his lima bean crops.

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el caserío Quemazón, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque. Aproximadamente a una hora de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace doce años a la preparación y venta de pan. Ella cuenta con un horno artesanal instalado en su domicilio donde prepara diariamente panes, bizcochos y galletas para venderlas al público en general y distribuirlas en las bodegas de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Con estos ingresos ella y su esposo sostienen la economía de su familia.

María desea adquirir algunos insumos al por mayor para poder almacenarlos y ahorrar dinero, ya que el precio de estos productos, como la harina y la levadura, son bastante inestables y muchas veces se elevan. Por ello ha decidido solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
María Esther, 39, is a mother living with her husband and minor son in Quemazón, a rural area in Mórrope district, located in Lambayeque province about an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been a baker for 12 years.  She has an artisanal oven in her home where she bakes bread, cookies and pastries daily to sell to the general public as well as to area grocery stores.  In addition she raises small farm animals.  Income from these activities makes it possible for her and her husband to support their family.

María wants to acquire some ingredients at wholesale to store them and save on costs because the price of these products, like flour and yeast, are quite unstable and often rise.  This is why she decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan.

She is quite a calm, responsible woman.  People who know her consider her to be honest and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy bread making ingredients.

loans.name: Maribel Rocío

texts.es:
La Señora. Maribel R. es socia del banco comunal Fe y Alegría, vive por el sector del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de sus calles, su centro histórico, su gente que es amable, cordial y aun mantienen sus tradiciones, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 12, 10, 8  y 3 años, sus dos últimos hijos son gemelos, su primera hija estudia en el colegio, su segunda y tercera hijas estudian  en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es laboratorista de suelos y con el trabajo y esfuerzo conyugal han logrado comprar su casa propia.

Doña Maribel es comerciante de ropa la misma que vende desde su casa todos los días sin un horario fijo, esta actividad  la viene realizando hace 10 años.
 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la fundación y el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir más su local.
 
Su meta es pagar la deuda de la compra de su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Maribel R. is a member of the "Fe y Alegría" ("Faith and Happiness") communal bank. She lives in the Cebollar neighbourhood in the city of Cuenca. This city is well known for the beauty of its streets and historic centre, as well as its friendly, polite and traditional people. It also boasts a great variety in its cuisine.

Our member is 33 years old. She is married and has 5 children, aged 12, 10, 8 and 3, with he youngest being twins. Her eldest daughter is studying in high school, her second and third daughters study at a city primary school. Her husband is a laboratory technician analysing soils, and with his job and their combined determination, they have succeeded in buying their own house.

Doña Maribel is a businesswoman, who sells clothing from home. She works every day, without fixed hours. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

This is the second loan she has had from the foundation, and she is going to invest the money in buying more clothing to sell. Her goal is to pay off the mortgage.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Anny Magdalena

texts.es:
Anny tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el anexo Guayaquil, distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella nos comenta que la idea del negocio nació debido a la necesidad de instalarse definitivamente en la zona por los problemas de salud que presentaba su hijo mayor. Anteriormente viajaba constantemente a la ciudad de Lima para traer mercadería y comercializarla en base a pedidos que le realizaban, pero ahora se dedica exclusivamente a la crianza de animales y a una pequeña bodega. Usualmente cría aves de corral y cuyes para luego venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive. Eventualmente también los comercializa entre sus vecinos. 

Anny ya ha realizado un préstamo que ha sido financiado por el Fondo Kiva. Ella lo utilizó para adquirir alimento para sus aves de corral y ahora su negocio ha ido creciendo de modo sostenido. Actualmente ella desea adquirir más alimento para sus animales, así como realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda. Por ello está solicitando nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles.

Anny se encuentra contenta y bastante agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través del programa Kiva.
texts.en:
Anny, 26, is married and lives with her husband and children in Guayaquil Annex, Cayaltí district, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises small farm animals.  She commented that the idea for the business arose from her need to stay permanently in the area due to health issues of her oldest son.  She used to travel constantly to the city of Lima to bring merchandise that she sold based on prior orders she’d get but now she is exclusively dedicated to raising small farm animals and tending to a small grocery store.  She usually raises barnyard fowl and guinea pigs to sell to merchants that visit the area where she lives.  Occasionally she sells them to her neighbors.

Anny has had a previous loan that was financed through Kiva funds.  She used it to get feed for the fowl and her business has now grown steadily.  She now wants to buy more animal feed as well as to make some home improvements.  For this reason she is once again requesting a 1600 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Anny is happy and quite grateful to the people who collaborated with her through the Kiva program.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Nancy Fabiola

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy es socia del banco comunal Fe y Alegría, vive por el sector de Medio Ejido en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de sus calles, su centro histórico, su gente que es amable, cordial y aun mantienen sus tradiciones, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

Doña Nancy tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13 y 7 años de edad,  sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultima hija está estudiando en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Nancy es comerciante de ropa, vende los días miércoles y lleva en el negocio  5 años, el resto de días se dedica al cuidado de su familia aprovechando el tiempo para vender cosméticos por catalogo y este negocio también lo tiene hace 4 años.
 
Es el octavo crédito que realiza la banca comunal y le han servido mucho para incrementar su mercadería, su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de más ropa para la navidad.
 
Su sueño es viajar a New York.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Fe y Alegría communal bank. She lives in the Medio Ejido area in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for the beauty of its streets, its historical center, its friendly, cordial people who still keep their traditions, and its variety of food. 

Nancy is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children, 15,13 and 7. Her first two children go to high school and the youngest daughter goes to an elementary school in the city. Her husband is a driver and works driving a truck. She doesn't own her own home and they rent.  
 
Nancy is a clothing merchant. She sells on Wednesdays and has had the business for 5 years. The rest of the time she takes care of her family and uses the time to sell cosmetics via catalog and she has had this business also for 4 years.  
 
This is the eighth loan with the communal and it has helped them a lot to increase their merchandise. The new loan will be used to invest in purchasing more clothing for Christmas.  
 
Her dream is to travel to New York.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Miguelina es una madre de familia de 61 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc, perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la venta de frutas en el interior del mercado de su localidad, ella ofrece a sus clientes frutas frescas de estación, el negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a que este centro de abastos es el principal de la localidad, Miguelina siempre atiende a sus clientes con un trato amable, por lo que cuenta siempre con un grupo de clientes fidelizados.

Miguelina ya ha trabajado con un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva que le sirvió para adquirir mas frutas con lo cual pudo ampliar su negocio, aumentar su nivel de ventas y percibir un mayor número de ganancias, la demanda por su negocio ha ido creciendo y actualmente ella ha creído conveniente solicitar nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en una nueva ampliación de su negocio.

Miguelina se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través del programa Kiva. Diariamente se esfuerza al máximo para poder percibir mayores ganancias y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Miguelina, 61, is a mother living with her husband and children in San Pedro de Lloc district, part of Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has sold fruit in her local market for the last 10 years.  She stocks fresh, seasonal fruit.  The business is well received because this is the city’s main foodstuffs market.  Miguelina always treats her customers with kindness so she can always count on a group of regular customers.

Miguelina has worked with a Kiva financed loan in the past that helped her buy more fruit thus expanding her business, improving her sales and earning higher profits.  Demand has increased so she needs to request another 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa for a new expansion of her business.

Miguelina is very grateful to all the people who collaborated with her through the Kiva program.  She exerts the maximum effort daily to earn higher profits and help her family get ahead.

loans.use: To buy fruit.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Carmen Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen E. es socia del banco comunal Fe y Alegría, vive por el sector de Uncovia en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de sus calles, su centro histórico, su gente que es amable, cordial y aun mantienen sus tradiciones, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de ropa, vende todos los días sin tener un horario fijo, realiza esta actividad hace 10 años. También cuando realizan campeonatos en una cancha a lado de su casa vende comida aprovechando la ocasión.
 
Doña Carmen tiene 58 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 35, 33, 31 y 25 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos últimos hijos trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar. Su esposo trabaja en una imprenta, tienen casa propia que fue construida con el trabajo y esfuerzo conyugal.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 11 años. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su mercadería, su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs.Carmen E. is a member of the Fe y Alegría communal bank. She lives in the Uncovia area of the city of Cuenca. The city is known for the beauty of its streets, its historical center, its friendly, cordial people who keep their traditions, and it variety of food.  
 
Our member sells clothes. She sells every day without a set schedule. She has done this for 10 years. She also sells food when they have championship tournaments at a field next to her house. 
 
Carmen is 58 years old. She is married and has 4 children, aged 35, 33, 31 and 25.  Her two oldest children are married and live independently and the youngest work and help out with the family finances. Her husband works at a printers. They own their own home built with the couple's work and effort.  

She has been a member of the commmunal bank for 11 years. The new loan will be used to invest in buying more clothes to increase her merchandise, Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro tiene 55 años de edad, es divorciado y vive junto a un hijo de 14 años de edad en el distrito de Reque, una zona urbana que se encuentra situada a más de quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al alquiler de equipo de sonido. El cuenta con una mezcladora y varioa amplificadores y los alquila para amenizar todo tipo de fiestas sociales y ceremonias. Sus clientes generalmente alquilan estos equipos los fines de semana. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad. Teodoro se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

El desea mejorar sus equipos adquiriendo una mejor consola y nuevos parlantes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su meta.

Teodoro es una persona bastante tranquila y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y que su negocio sea el más conocido por la zona.
texts.en:
Teodoro, 55, is divorced and lives with a 14 year old son in Reque district, an urban area located fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He rents sound systems.  He has a synthesizer and several speakers that he rents out for all kinds of social events and ceremonies.  His customers usually rent the equipment on weekends.  Income from these rentals makes it possible for Teodoro to support his family.

He wants to improve the equipment buying a better console and new speakers.  He feels asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan then is a good idea to reach his goal.

Teodoro is quite levelheaded and hard working.  His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman and that his business becomes very well known throughout the area.

loans.use: To buy sound equipment to stock his sound equipment rental business.

loans.name: María Ysabel

texts.es:
María Ysabel tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Quemazón, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque. Aproximadamente a una hora de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir para todo público, ella trabaja en base a pedidos y compra su mercadería en la ciudad de Lima, debido al tiempo que lleva laborando en esta actividad se ha vuelto una persona bastante conocida en el rubro y cuenta con una clientela fiel. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y hacerse cargo de la economía de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

María es una mujer tranquila y bastante responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María Ysabel is 26 years old, is single, and lives with her family in the Quemazón settlement.  It is a rural area in Mórrope District, which is located in Lambayeque Province about an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She works selling clothing for all sizes.  María's work is based on customer orders, and she buys her merchandise in the city of Lima.  Owing to the length of time she has been doing this work, she has become well-known in this area and has regular customers.  The income she earns is used to cover household expenses and support her family.

María wants to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise.  For this reason she has applied for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  She is asking for 1000 new soles, which will help her achieve her goal.

María is a calm and very responsible woman.  Her greatest desire is to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Clothing purchases to expand clothing business

loans.name: Humberto

texts.en:
Humberto is 42 years old. He lives along with his partner and parents in a home that is shared by all. They live in the district of Tambogrande, a rural area in northern Peru that consists primarily of small farms.

Humberto and his father work together on a farm that is owned by the father. They raise mango and limes on their property, working long hours to protect the crop from pests and to maintain the attractive appearance of the fruit that is so prized in the international market. Additionally, they raise sheep and cattle, an activity that helps to stabilize the family income. They have worked the land and raised animals for many years and are very well respected in the area for their products.

Humberto’s father is over 70 years old and has limited access to credit due to worries about his health.  Humberto is therefore the primary borrower and his father is acting as a guaranty. They plan to invest the funds in their farm in order to maintain production and improve their product.

loans.use: To invest in the farm to maintain production

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol  G. V. is 45 years old.  She is a single mother who lives with her son and parents in the village of Santa Cruz in the district of Tambogrande.  It is a traditionally rural area with a large number of small farms, specifically mango and lime growers.

Each day Marisol can be found attending clients in the front of her home in the small general storefront which she maintains.  She sells items of basic needs such as soap, hygene products, canned food, beverages, small gifts, and candy.  She has been managing her business for a number of years and is well versed in the business.  Her parents are both retired and on pensions.

This is Marisol’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  Marisol has requested the loan in order to expand her inventory and supplement her ongoing purchases.  She hopes to be able to expand her store in order to meet the further needs of her customers.  She is very well liked by the community.

loans.use: To purchase products for her store

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Maria, 29, lives in the region of Piura in the district of Tambogrande. It is a more humid region of northern Peru which grows a large quantity of mangoes and limes. She lives in her own home along with her partner and their three children.

Maria manages a small general store in the front of her home, selling everything from candy to rice to toilet paper to gifts. She is very well known in the area due to her high quality products and good selection.

This will be her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa with which she hopes to take advantage of bulk discounts and expand her inventory in order to increase her market share. She feels confident about the demand for her products.

One of her greatest dreams is to see her children become professionals and receive good educations. She is dedicated to her family and the success of her business which provides for their well being.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her store

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa lives in her own home along with her partner and their three children. She is 29 years old. She and her family live in Santa Rosa in the province of Piura. Each Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Monday, one can find Josefa in the district of Los Lomos, approximately 20 minutes from her home, selling food and chicha (chicha is a traditional beverage in Peru made from corn and alcohol). She sells her goods to clients who pass by in the streets at the end of their daily labors or who are heading to other projects. She has requested a loan of 500 Soles in order to purchase additional products and increase her supply. She will use the loan little by little, purchasing fresh goods daily. She hopes that this purchase will allow her to increase her market share and income. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her kids. She hopes to be able to get them through school and see them become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase additional products and increase her supply

loans.name: Blanca Nieves

texts.es:
La Señora Blanca M. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en el centro de la Ciudad de Azogues, que se halla localizado en las suaves estribaciones y declives que en contraste a los encuentros de los diferentes ramales conforman gargantas y cañadas muy apretadas con fuertes inclinaciones y diferencias de nivel muy pronunciadas, siendo una ciudad muy hermosa y bella por su gente y su cultura.

La Señora Blanca tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 1 año de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica al comercio de lotería, periódicos y  libros al igual que nuestra socia ya que son distribuidores de estos artículos, laboran de domingo a domingo sin tener un horario fijo. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y fué invitada por su cuñada, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas billetes de lotería.
 
Su meta es  comprarse una casa o un terreno.
texts.en:
Blanca M. is a member of the community bank named "Working Women". She lives in the downtown area in the city of Azogues. The city is located among the soft hills and valleys in an otherwise mountainous geography with pronounced cliffs and canyons. The city is a very beautiful city especially for its people and its culture. 

Blanca is 32 years old, she is married and she has 3 children, aged 11, 9 and 1. Her two eldest children attend a school in the city. Her husband sells lottery tickets, newspapers, and books.  She sells the same types of merchandise and they both function as distributors of these items.  They work from Sunday to Sunday, though they do not have a fixed schedule. They do not have a home of their own, so they rent the place where they live. 

This is her second loan she has accessed. She was originally invited to join the community bank by her mother-in-law. The funds from this loan will be used to purchase more lottery tickets for resale. 

Her goal is to purchase a house or a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase lottery tickets.

loans.name: María Luzmila

texts.es:
La Señora. María C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la comunidad de Sagueo a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad se halla localizado en las suaves estribaciones y declives que en contraste a los encuentros de los diferentes ramales conforman gargantas y cañadas muy apretadas con fuertes inclinaciones y diferencias de nivel muy pronunciadas, siendo una ciudad muy hermosa y bella por su gente y su cultura.

Doña María se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa de la banca comunal. Se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería hace 12 años, labora de 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde todos los días sin descansar uno solo, también se dedica a lustrar zapatos.
 
La Señora. María tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 25, 24, 20, 17, 10 y 7 años de edad, tres de sus hijos se dedican a trabajar y ayudar en la economía del hogar, su tercera hija estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, con su trabajo han logrado construir una casita pequeña. Su esposo también se dedica a lustrar zapatos en la ciudad.

Su primer crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de más billetes de lotería. Su meta es crecer en este negocio.
texts.en:
Maria C. is a member of the community bank named "Working Women". She lives in the downtown area in the city of Azogues. The city is located among the soft hills and valleys in an otherwise mountainous geography with pronounced cliffs and canyons. The city is a very beautiful city especially for its people and its culture. 

This is Maria's first loan through her community bank. She was originally invited to join by a friend, an active member of the group. She has been selling lottery tickets for the past 12 years, working 7 days a week until 5pm every day while never taking a day off. She also offers shoe shines. 

Maria is 43 years old, she is married and she has 6 children, aged 23, 24, 20, 17, 10 and 7 years. Three of her children work and contribute towards the household finances. Her third daughter is in university and the two youngest children attend a school in the city. Through her work she has managed to build a small house. Her husband also offers shoe shines in the city. 

She will invest her loan in the purchase of more lottery tickets. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase lottery tickets.

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
La Señora Ana M. vive es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la comunidad de Sagueo a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad se halla localizado en las suaves estribaciones y declives que en contraste a los encuentros de los diferentes ramales conforman gargantas y cañadas muy apretadas con fuertes inclinaciones y diferencias de nivel muy pronunciadas, siendo una ciudad muy hermosa y bella por su gente y su cultura.

La Señora Ana tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad y un bebe de apenas de 2 meses, su primer hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad.  Su esposo es de profesión mecánico. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Ana se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería, actividad que la viene realizando hace un año, labora de lunes a sábado sin un horario fijo.

Es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, fue invitada por su hermana a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres que con su trabajo luchan día a día para mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más billetes de lotería.

Su meta es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana M. is a member of the community bank named "Working Women". She lives in the community of Saguo located 10 minutes from the city of Azogues. The city is located among the soft hills and valleys in an otherwise mountainous geography with pronounced cliffs and canyons. The city is a very beautiful city especially for its people and its culture. 

Ana is 28 years old, she is married and she has 3 children aged, 7, 3 and a 2 month-old baby. Her eldest son attends school in the city. Her husband is a mechanic by trade. They do not have a house of their own so they rent where they live.

Ana sells lottery tickets, a business she has had for the past year. She works from Monday to Saturday and she doesn't have a fixed schedule. 

This is the second loan she accesses through her community bank. She was invited to join the group by her sister, wanting her to be part of this group of women who work day after day to improve their household finances. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of lottery tickets. 

Her goal is to have a house of her own. 
.

loans.use: To purchase lottery tickets.

loans.name: Las Rosarinas Group

texts.es:
La señora Nelly empezó vendiendo golosinas en una pequeña vitrina con muy pocas cosas alguna que otra golosina para ofrecer como galletas, chocolates y  bebidas, con mucho esfuerzo en estos 7 años que han pasado ha podido  aumentar su capital y D. esa manera su negocio ha mejorado convirtiéndose en la “BODEGA YORDI” una bodega mas granD. y con muchos productos, ahora no solo venD. golosinas además D. eso tiene productos D. abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros alimentos D. pan llevar al tener D. todo  mantiene contenta  a su clientela que acuD. a su negocio cada día.
 Con sus ingresos pueD. cubrir algunos gastos extras y sobretodo ayudar en la educación D. sus 4 hijos pequeños, que aun asisten a la escuela, mas adelante quiere incursionar en el negocio D. la ferretería pero por ahora esta dedicada completamente a su bodega este préstamo lo utilizara para abastecerse D. mercadería en general entre abarrotes, bebidas, como presidenta del grupo “LAS ROSARINAS “quiere trabajar y salir adelante junto a sus compañeras.

* Nelly es la señora que esta sentada, la segunda D. la derecha.
texts.en:
Nelly started selling snacks out of a small display case with just a few items like cookies, chocolates and beverages.  With much effort over the last 7 years she has increased her working capital and her business has improved becoming “BODEGA YORDI,” a larger store with many more products. Now, she doesn’t just sell snacks; she also has other grocery items like rice, sugar, noodles and baked goods hoping to have everything to keep the customers that come to her store daily happy.

Income from the store makes it possible for her to see to extra expenses and mostly for the education of her four small children that are still in school.  Later on she wants to go into the hardware business but for now she’s completely dedicated to her grocery store.

She will use this loan to stock up on general merchandise like groceries and beverages.  As President of the “LAS ROSARINAS” group she wants to work and get ahead together with her fellow group members.

*Nelly is seated, she’s the second one from the right.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Odhuu

texts.en:
Odhuu B. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. He lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in a permanent location for the past 7 years. His two children both attend a local secondary school.

He sells firewood and barley flour which he produces in his home, with help of his wife in their town. He started his firewood trading business in 2008, after working as a flour packer in the flour company in Uvs between 2007 and 2008. He has managed to save 1,500,000 MNT in the bank by working in the construction field with help of his son this summer. With his loan plus his bank savings, he is planning to purchase a new car in order to operate a taxi service in his town. For the future, he hopes to plant seabuckthorn. Odhuu is a hardworking and organized man and says, " I want to provide a good education for my children". He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a car that will be used as a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: Badamtuya

texts.en:
Badamtuya L. is a 39 year old single mother who lives with her two sons in Uvs province, Mongolia. She and her two sons live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son currently attends a local high school. Her husband passed away 2 years ago.

Badamtuya operates a clothing retail business out of a rented stall at the local market. She started her business in 2003 with the help of her husband. Her sibling has helped her in the summertime. She has found success in her trade and has used her earnings to support her family. Today, her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. She imports a variety of clothing items once every quarter of the year from Erlian, a border city of China. She pays 45,000 MNT in monthly rent fees. Moreover, she plants vegetables in her yard. Badamtuya is a very open minded and hardworking woman and says, "I work hard to provide for my two sons." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to import more inventory at wholesale prices from China to sell at her stall.

loans.use: To import more inventory.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa T. is 21 years old and lives with her mother, husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in their own small apartment.

Bolormaa's mother has been operating a clothing trade business in Narantuul Trade market in the city since 2007 and she manages this business with help of her husband today. Bolormaa provides a variety of clothing and t-shirts to satisfy their customers' needs. Over the years, the family business has reached a sustainable level. Her purpose of applying for the bank loan is to increase her working capital. For the future, she hopes to improve her house. She is a very modest person. Bolormaa is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital for her retail business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Buyanbadrah

texts.en:
Buyanbadrah D. is 22 years old and an orphan. He lives with his brother in the Uvs province, Mongolia, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. He has a girlfriend whose name is Saraa.

Buyanbadrah operates his own taxi service. He worked in the construction field with the help of his brother this summer, and has been able to open a savings account with 2,000,000 MNT in the XacBank. His business was successful enough to upgrade his car by purchasing a car for 3,000,000 MNT. His monthly average income is between 180,000-200,000 MNT. Buyanbadrah is a modest and handsome young man who is not afraid of hard work and hopes to get married soon. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT in order to purchase a car.

loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat L. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All three children attend a local school, while his wife operates a clothes trading business in a rented stall at the Ayanchin market. He operates a taxi service using his own car. He and his family used to live in the countryside, leading a nomadic lifestyle, but unfortunately they lost all their livestock during a harsh winter and moved to his current town where he started his transportation business in 2000 after purchasing his own small car.

After several successful years driving a taxi, he was able to save up money to start another business by selling a variety of clothing items, imported from China, in a rented stall at the local market, in 2006. Today, both businesses have become stable. Erdenebat is a talkative and open-minded man. He will save enough money to purchase an apartment with 2-3 rooms for his family, in the future. Erdenebat is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig P. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. He lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His four children all attend a local school, while his wife takes care of their infant son.

Ganzorig operates a coal and firewood trading business in his town. He has been engaged this business for the past 6 years with his wife. He purchases one truck of firewood and coal at wholesale price, and then packs it into bags to sell to the local people during the winter. His business sales profit per truck is between 60,000 and 70,000 MNT. He has the capacity to purchase 4 trucks of firewood and coal, and eventually he would like to increase it to 5-6 trucks of firewood and coal in the future. During the summer, he operates a transportation business using his motorcycle to supplement his family's income. Now, he is planning to sell his motorcycle and hopes to buy a new car in order to start a taxi service in his town. Ganzorig is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase 2 trucks of coal and 2 trucks of firewood to sell as a retailer.

loans.use: To purchase 2 trucks of coals and 2 trucks of firewood.

loans.name: Burenjargal

texts.en:
Burenjargal D. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent.  His two children, ages 16 and 14, both attend a local high school and his oldest daughter, age 21, attends university.

Burenjargal operates a grocery business next to his home with the help of his wife. In the beginning, he started selling a limited variety of food stuffs in his small kiosk in 2002, and has since managed to open his own grocery shop. With his grocery business profit, Burenjargal was able not only to improve his family's quality of life, but also to pay his son's tuition fees. He would like to one day own a bigger grocery store, where he can sell a larger variety of goods that will attract many more customers. His wife is responsible for managing the grocery shop, while he uses his car to drive a taxi to supplement his family income. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan so that he can purchase a larger variety of products to sell at his grocery shop.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of products.

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar T. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayanhoshuu of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two children attend university while his wife helps him with the business.

Enhbayar owns and operates his own wooden products business, specializing in home kitchen furniture. He started his business in 2003 by making a variety of wooden products alone in his home. Over the many years of business, he has managed to expand his business and hire two more employees. His wife sells those products in a rented stall at the Narantuul, the largest market in Ulaanbaatar. He would like to increase his sales so that he can afford to build a house by the end of next year with his business profits. For the future, he plans to establish his own furniture making center in his yard after building a big house. Enhbayar is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials.

loans.use: To purchase more materials.

loans.name: Gereltsogt

texts.en:
Gereltsogt H. is a 34 year old widower who lives with his 8 year old daughter in Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his daughter live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian home tent. His wife passed away 3 years ago. The family had been happily living in the countryside, leading a nomadic lifestyle, until the tragic incident happened to his family.

After that, he sold all his livestock and moved to his current town. He began his taxi service in 2007, after purchasing a new car, and has built a stable operation over the years. Gereltsogt earns a monthly average profit of 180,000 MNT. With his earning, he was able to start building a house for his family. He works hard to finish construction of his house by next year. He is a very modest man and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase winter tires for his car and necessary materials for his house, which is under construction.

loans.use: To purchase winter tires and materials.

loans.name: Hishigmaa

texts.en:
Hishigmaa D. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her two children attend university.

Hishigmaa and her husband operate a button making business in their home. They purchases necessary raw materials from China to produce a variety of buttons that are used for the Mongolian traditional coat called deel. They have been engaged in this business since 1996 and have gained many years of experience as producers. Her business has been quite successful and her earnings have allowed her to continue paying her children's tuition fees. She is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan  in order to pay her children's tuition fees as well as to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Ligsaa

texts.en:
Ligsaa H. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Harhorin, the ancient city of Mongolian empire. His daughter attends a local elementary school and his wife works as a milkmaid with 50,000 MNT of monthly salary.

Ligsaa has been working as a carpenter and providing a service to saw wood for households since 2000 and has gained much experience. He usually produces a truck of firewood, worth between 20,000 and 40,000 MNT, using his own handsaw. With his loan, he is planning to purchase a new motorcycle and start operating a transportation business in his town in order to support his family. He is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan, plus his own cash, in order to purchase a new motorcycle at 800,000 MNT for his future transportation business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Otgonbaatar D. is 22 years old young man, who lives with his father in Harhorin, the ancient capital city of Mongolian empire, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His father is retired and receives a pension for old age per month.

Otgonbaatar owns a carpentry business in his town. He used to live in the countryside and today he has his own 100 livestock. He began his wooden product making business in 2009, purchasing necessary tools and equipment after obtaining a business loan from XacBank. For the future, he plans to work as a carpenter in the Bat-Ulzii sub province.

Otgonbaatar is a very modest and hardworking man. He needs more funds in order to get married and live on his own, and is therefore requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials in order to increase his sales as well as to purchase a ger cover for his future home.

loans.use: To purchase a ger cover.

loans.name: Urtnasan

texts.en:
Urtnasan L. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Harhorin, the ancient city of Mongolian empire, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. The family all lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.
