Her oldest son, age 21, works as an electrician in the local museum and her two children, ages 19 and 17, both attend university, while her youngest daughter attends a local secondary school.

Her husband works as a watchman in the Harhorin company and Urtnasan operates a mobile dairy trading business which purchases the dairy products from herders at wholesale price and resells at the local market for profit. She started this business in 1998 and has gained much experience as a trader. Urtnasan is a very modest and hardworking woman and says, "I work hard to provide a good education for my children. My wish is that my children could obtain good occupations for the future." Urtnasan is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy supplies in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy supplies.

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en: Dolgormaa P. lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in her sibling's yard. Dolgormaa operates a used clothing retail business in the Narantuul market, one of the largest and most crowded markets in Ulaanbaatar. She began her business in 2004 and has built a stable and successful operation. After years of hard work, she has gained not only a wide range of customers base but also lots of experience as a businesswoman. Today, her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT with 30 percent of net profit. She is a very energetic and honest woman and says, “Soon, we hope to buy our own apartment. We are saving money for that." Dolgormaa is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Ariuntungalag

texts.en:
Ariuntungalag B. is a 37 years old and lives with her husband and teenage daughter in an apartment in Gobisumer, Mongolia. Her daughter attends a local high school and her husband is currently unemployed after working as a railroader in the railway station of Choir.

Ariuntungalag operates a cafe named "Ih Sansar" in her town. Ariuntungalag started her business in 2006 with the help of her sister, and since then has built a stable operation and has gained much experience as well. After years of successful operations, she has been saving money in order to purchase a car for her family. Moreover, she is now thinking about expanding further and plans to open a grocery shop which will be managed by her sister to have her own workplace. Ariuntungalag is a very honest, resolute and hardworking woman and is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary equipment such as a refrigerator, freezer, etc., to start her grocery shop in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the expenses of his wedding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new carpet-weaving frame

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a new cart and more fresh fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Ruqqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqqiya is 26 years of age, married to G. Q., who runs a grocery store in the market. Other earning people in the family are her mother-in-law and brother-in-law. Her brother-in-law has a business of selling sweetmeats and her mother-in-law is a nurse by profession. They all live together as a combined family system.

Ruqqiya herself is a caring and simple lady. She spends her time at home and carries out the responsibilities of a housewife and a mother well. She has 3 children, 2 sons and a daughter. All of them are very young and have not started to attend school yet. Ruqqiya lives in a city named Jaranwala, which is a small city located in Punjab and famous for its agriculture industry in Pakistan.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s grocery business. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries for his grocery shop, which he has run for the past 5 years in the market. Ruqqiya is hopeful that with the loan money, her husband will be able to get a better income by increasing his sales.
 
She is a new loan applicant and is hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Ruqqiya”.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials and tools for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is an educated lady. She has completed her education to 12th standard and now performs her duty as a teacher in a school. She chose this work as a profession, because she loves teaching and her profession now helps her to financially support her family. She is the resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city of Punjab and famous for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. She lives in a 2 room brick house with her family. She moved here after her marriage. She is 33 years old and has no children yet. Her husband is a vegetable seller by profession and works in a vegetable market. Her father-in-law is also a working person in the family and is involved in a fruit selling business.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy fresh seasonal vegetables and increase his sales. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will develop by investing money in it.  

She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In her previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

Note: “In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Kalsoom”.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables for vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more good quality cosmetics.

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran lives in a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan called Jaranwala. She lives there in a 3 room brick house with her family. She is 52 year's old and operates a dairy business at her home. She has some buffalos at her home and gets milk from them to sell in her community.  This earns her a good income every month and she can easily manage the utilities expenses of her home. 

Her husband has a tailoring shop in the market and her son also works in that shop helping his father to complete the sewing orders on time. Her daughter is 16 years old, stays at home and helps with the household works. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her dairy business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo to increase the milk production. This will help her serve more clients and increase her income. She has been doing this business for the last 10 years and is confident that her business will grow by investing money into it. 

Ameeran wants to marry her daughter soon and she is sure that the increased income will help her in making all the arrangements for her daughter’s marriage.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, Ameeran has built a good credit rating and has never missed any meeting.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Ameeran”.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to iincrease his business

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She is 30 years of age and has a daughter, who is studying in 2nd grade. Her husband operates a grocery store in the market. Khalida stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very good mother who is raising her daughter with great care and discipline. She lives in a combine family system along with her 3 brother-in-laws also live. They do different kind of works to contribute to the family financially. 

Her husband started the grocery store business 5 years ago and it has earned him good income. Now he wants to expand his business for which he needs to invest capital.  Therefore, Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries in bulk quantity and increase his sales. His shop is located in a busy place and he faces high competition every day from other grocery stores. The bulk items will help him retain his customers and to grow by keeping in stock the  items required by his customers. Khalida is hopeful that this investment will bring increased profits to her husband’s business and her family’s living standard will get improved. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Khalida”.

loans.use: To buy groceries for the grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy essential equipment for a beauty salon

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in a city called Jaranwala with her family in the area named Kot kabeer, in a 2 room brick house. She is a mother of 2 daughters and 3 sons. All of them are young and don’t go to school because Shahnaz and her husband couldn’t afford their education expenses. 

Her husband has a motorbike rental business. He gives motorbikes on rent to people for specific time periods and charge them on hourly basis. 
He also operates a grocery shop. He has made a room of his house for this purpose and has been operating it for the past 5 years. In his absence, shahnaz operates his business and serves his clients. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s grocery shop business. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries in bulk quantity and improve his grocery business. Shahnaz is hopeful that her husband will make full use of money and improve his business. 

Shahnaz is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has built a good credit record and never missed any meeting.
 
Note: “In this photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Shahnaz”.

loans.use: To buy groceries fora  grocery shop

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is a resident of Jaranwala, a small city located in Punjab Province of Pakistan. A 28-year-old childless widow who lost her husband at a very early age, Shameen moved to her parents' home and started a grocery shop business, dedicating a room in her home for that purpose. She has three brothers, all of whom are pursuing different livelihoods.

Shameem is now requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy additional groceries to sell. She is hopeful that she will earn extra profits from this loan investment and be able to save money for a secure future.

This is Shameem's second loan from Asasah. In the previous loan year, she built a good credit record and attended all meetings.

Note: In this photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Shameem.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Roslan

texts.en:
Roslan is a 23 year old single man living in Chtoura. Since 2002, he has worked as a van driver. Roslan loves his transportation work and feels it is very speciA. because he meets a lot of tourists from different countries with different cultures and personalities.

Roslan is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua to fund necessary maintenance for his car. In the future, he hopes to own a large number of tourism vans and start a tour agency.

loans.use: For necessary car maintenance

loans.name: Inaam

texts.en:
Inaam is a 54 year old single woman from Chtoura. Since 1995, she has owned a grocery store and she has 35 years of experience in this field. Inaam is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to add new products to her store and increase her income to improve her life. 

This is Inaam’s forth loan from Al Majmoua, and she is a client with a good standing history. Her customers like dealing with her and state that Inaam is a very welcoming person. Inaam hopes to expand her business and open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to add new products to her store

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer is 38 years old and the married father of three children. Since 2009, he has been the owner of a shoe store. Samer used to own a restaurant, but he wanted to try another type of work and he found that it was a good decision to change. Samer is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to buy shoes for a new fall and winter collection. Samer’s clients are foreigners, relatives, neighbors and friends. He hopes to start selling clothes as well as shoes in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoes for a new fall and winter collection

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 35 year old married man who owns a farm in Chtoura. Since 2005 he has been raising cows on his farm and he has 20 years of experience. Fadi is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to continue doing necessary maintenance on his farm before the winter season. 

Fadi is an ambitious man who seeks the best in everything he does and he works hard to do what is best for his cows and their production. His clients are wholesale traders. Fadi started his business with a weak financial situation and he has worked hard to reach his current level. Fadi’s ambition is to expand his business and to own a bigger farm to increase his income and improve his family’s financial and social situation.

loans.use: To do necessary farm maintenance

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan. In this photo she is holding a book, called an Asasah passbook. She is 35 years old has lived with her family in a three-room brick house for over 12 years. Kalsoom has five sons, but only two of them are in school due to the financial state of Kalsoom and her husband, who works in the field and grows different crops. 

Kalsoom supports her husband financially by selling clothes. She buys clothes from Lahore and sells them to her local market to make a profit. She has been doing this work for over five years. Kalsoom has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to expand her clothing business. With the loan money she will buy bulk quantity clothes of different varieties. This variety will increase her sales because her customers will have more choice. 

This is Kalsoom’s second loan from Asasah. She built good credit during the previous loan year and has never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 20 year old single man from Chtoura. Since 2007, he has been working as a tractor and diesel mechanic. He has 12 years of experience. Ali is requesting a loan for the first time from A. Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools for his business. Ali would like to by a "balango" which is a machine used to move tractor engines and parts from one place to another to make maintenance easier. He also would like to buy new mechanic tools. 

Ali's clients are farmers, friends, and neighbors. He loves his work and has been working with machines since he was eight years old and helping his parents with the family income. Ali hopes to expand and improve his workplace as much as he can. He is still young and believes he can work hard and do his utmost to become the best.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the rest of his pickup truck.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 27 year old single man. He has been in the cardboard industry since 2006 and has 10 years of experience. Hasan is requesting a loan for the second time from A. Majmoua; he will use this loan to buy used cardboard to store for recycling in the future. Although at the beginning he faced problems because he wasn't experienced in his field, now everything is turning better. Hasan hopes to expand his factory in the near future to a bigger one.

loans.use: To buy used cardboard to store for recycling in the future.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She lives in the area named Kot kabeer with her family in a three room brick house. Shamim is 45 years old and married to M. A.; they have five children. All of her children had to leave their education early due to the poor financial condition of Shamim and her husband. Her elder son works in a factory, while the second one works in a gas station. Her husband has a small piece of land where he grows different crops. Shamim helps her husband financially by selling milk from her buffalo and she has a good client base because of the pure quality of the milk she sells. She has been working at this business for over 10 years; her earnings allow her to pay for the basic needs of her family. Shamim wants to buy another buffalo to fulfill the demand for milk from her clients, which is why she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah. She is hopeful that this investment will provide her with a  good profit. This is her 2nd loan application from Asasah. In her previous loan year, she built good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.  

Note: “In this photo, the lady who holds the book, which is the Asasah Passbook, is Shamim”.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her dairy business.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She has lived with her family in the area named Kot kabeer in a 2 room brick house for the last 16 years. She is married to M. N., who has a business of selling ice blocks in his community.

Razia herself owns and operates a milk selling business in her community. She has a buffalo at her home which gives her almost 8kg milk every day. She takes care of her buffalo by providing timely food and water.
  
She is a mother of 2 sons and a daughter. All of them are young and don’t go to school because Razia and N. didn’t have enough resources to afford their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her milk selling business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo for increasing the milk quantity and sales. She is hopeful that this loan investment will bring positive changes to her business and makes her income double in size. 

Razia is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she built a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: “In this photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Razia”.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
For the last 20 years Nasreen has been living in a three-room brick house with her family in Jaranwala, a small city in Punjab famous for its agricultural industry. She is a housewife and spends most of her time performing her household responsibilities, while her husband, G. H., works in a sugar mill earning a meager income.

Nasreen is the mother of four sons, three of whom are illiterate, and a daughter. Her eldest son drives a rented rickshaw, while the second eldest works in a private company on a monthly wage, and the youngest to them has a carpet weaving business. Her remaining two children are enrolled in school.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son. With the loan, he will buy a rickshaw because the rented rickshaw doesn’t allow him to work for more hours and he has to pay a portion of the earned amount to the rickshaw owner at the day's end. Nasreen is hopeful that by purchasing a rickshaw, her son will be able to work as long as he wants and can earn good income by serving more passengers.

Nasreen is a regular borrower from Asasah, and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she responsibly paid her installments and never missed any meetings.

. Note: In the photo, the lady shown holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for the business

loans.name: Surriaya's Group

texts.en:
Surriaya (pictured with the book in her hands) is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan that is famous for its agricultural industry. She is a housewife, who stays at home. She explains that she is a very active a responsible lady, who takes her household responsibilities very seriously and manages them well. She is married to M., a retired government employee.

Surriaya and her husband have four sons and one daughter. Her three oldest sons are illiterate. They could not get an education due to their family's dire financial situation. As a result, those boys started working at a very early age: her oldest son has a clothing sales business; her next oldest son works in a factory and earns a monthly wage; and her third oldest son is a day laborer. Yet things are different now: her two youngest children are enrolled in a school and are receiving an education.

Surriaya is now seeking a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her oldest son’s business. With the loan proceeds, he would like to buy a wide variety of clothes in bulk. The variety of clothes enables him to sell clothes to many customers and to thereby generate good profits. He has been operating this business for the last 10 years, and Surriaya is very confident that her son will be able to expand his business with the help of this loan. Notably, she is a regular client of Asasah, and this would be her third loan through Asasah. With respect to her prior loans, she responsibly paid her installments and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To expand inventory by purchasing a variety of clothes in bulk

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen (pictured with the book in her hands) is a 45-year-old woman who is married to M. A.. They reside in Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. Ever since her marriage, she has lived with her family in a three-room brick house. Her husband is a carpet-weaver by profession. She, meanwhile, is a housewife who does her household chores at home. She has given birth to five sons and a daughter. Her three oldest sons work in factories and receive meager incomes, while her three youngest children are receiving their education at a local school.

Nasreen is now seeking a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan proceeds, her husband would like to buy carpet-weaving raw materials such as thread, weaving tools, and sketches. Weaving carpets by hand is a very difficult task but A. does this job well, primarily because he knows that he needs to provide financial support for their family. Nasreen is hopeful that her husband will make good use of the loan proceeds and will be able to generate an increase in profits by weaving additional carpets. Notably, this would be her second loan from Asasah. With respect to the prior loan, she paid her installments on time and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials for a carpet-weaving business

loans.name: Banu's Group

texts.en:
Banu (pictured with the book in her hands) is a hard-working woman who lives in Jaranwala, a small city of in the Punjab region of Pakistan that is famous for its agricultural industry. She is married to H. A., who is 60 years old and cannot work due to his old age. She has given birth to three sons. She and her husband were unable to provide their first two sons with an education. Those two sons work in a factory and receive a monthly wage.

She supports her family by selling clothes for a living. She started this business 10 years ago and now serves a good client base. Specifically, she imports clothes from the markets of Lahore and Faisalabad and then sells the clothes to her local markets.

She is now seeking a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, to expand and improve her business. With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy clothes of a wide variety in bulk. Purchasing in bulk will minimize her costs and also cut her travel expenses every month. She is hopeful that, with the help of this loan, her business will improve and her profits will rise. Notably, this would be her third loan from Asasah. With respect to her two previous loans, she responsibly made her installment payments on time and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing a variety of clothes in bulk

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya lives in Jaranwala, a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and famous for its agricultural industry. She owns a two-room house in the area called 121.G.B and has been living in it with her family since she married A. G.. 

Her husband has a dairy business. For this purpose, he keeps some buffaloes at his home. The buffaloes give him a good quantity of milk, which he sells to different milk vendors in order to earn a good profit. Suraiya helps her husband in getting milk from his buffaloes. They both get up early in the morning and work hard to improve their financial condition.
  
Suraiya is the mother of four sons. All of them are young and do different kinds of work to contribute financially to the family. Her eldest son is an ironsmith. The next oldest helps his father in his dairy business, and the other two work in a brick furnace and manufacture bricks. 
 
Suraiya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo for his dairy business. The additional buffalo will help him increase the milk quantity, and his income as well. Suraiya is a regular user of Asasah, and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she responsibly paid her installments and attended every meeting. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Suraiya.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for the dairy business

loans.name: Siddiqan's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqan lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city located in Punjab and is known for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. She is 54 years old and is still very active at this age. She spends her time at home doing her household responsibilities. 

She is married to G. R. who works in the field and grows rice. She has 3 sons and a daughter. All of her children left their education at an early stage and started doing work to financially support the family. 

Her eldest son is 30 years old and has a grocery store business. The next eldest son is a driver by profession, and the youngest has a poultry business.  Siddiqan has applied for a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her eldest son’s grocery store. With the loan, he will put groceries in his grocery store to increase his sales. He started this business 4 years ago, and Siddiqan is very much hopeful that by investing loan money in his business, her son will successfully be able to make his income double in size.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Siddiqan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Consolate Akinyi

texts.en:
Consolata is a widow with two children whom she supports.

Consolata joined KADET through members and she is currently servicing a third loan. The previous loans were repaid successfully. 

Consolata has been in the business of selling second-hand clothes for 13 years and with this current loan, Consolata shall purchase more bales of second-hand clothes for sale.

With the profits, Consolata will build more rental rooms on the piece of land on which she resides, and she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees and provide food and clothing with her business income.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Getaro Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and they have two children.

Mary is servicing a first loan in KADET and has no other MFI (microfinance institution) history. She has been in the general store business for two years and her business is in a densely populated area. With the loan, Mary shall purchase stock for her food shop as well as renovate some portion of the shop.

Mary plans to use the profits that she'll earn from the business to complete some rental rooms for occupation by tenants as she becomes a landlord. Mary hopes to be financially stable and increase her rental income.

loans.use: The loan will be used to renovate her retail shop and add more stock of items like food

loans.name: Milka Jemutai

texts.en:
Milka Jemutai K. is a 39-year-old lady who is married to Elias Kiptoo Kimutai, a farmer. They are blessed with three children, aged 18 years, 13 years and 7 years respectively. They live in the rift areas of Kenya called Eldoret. 

Milka owns an open-air stall where she sells assorted household goods and utensils at a profit. She has been in this business for the past 13 years with an income of 3,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs.) per month.

Milka was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and she is applying for her fourth loan of Kshs. 60,000 with KADET LTD, after paying her previous loans successfully. With this loan, she plans to buy more utensils of different kinds.

She hopes to operate a wholesale version of the same business and in the future, to extend the same services to the city center.

loans.use: To buy more utensils

loans.name: Simion Kipngetich

texts.en:
Simion Kipngetich B. is 29 years old.  He is married to Sarah Chepkemboi, a businesswoman whose work provides an additional source of income for the family.  Simion and Sarah have two school-going children, aged four and one.  They come from Eldoret, a town in the Rift Valley Province of Kenya.  Simion sells cereals, has been in this business for four years, and earns a monthly profit of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).  He also has a motorbike, which makes transporting his cereals from farms to the shop easy.

Simion learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness in the area.  He is applying for the sixth loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to buy two bags of rice, one bag of beans, and one bag of green grams (mung beans).  He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his cereal business.

In the future, Simion wishes to expand his business further.  His deepest desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy two bags of rice, one bag of beans, and one bag of green grams

loans.name: Stephen Barasa

texts.en:
Stephen is 44 years old, married to Mary Awino and they have 3 children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 63,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorbike.

In the future, Stephen hopes to diversify and open up a retail shop that will be operated by his wife.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Zakaria Muteti

texts.en:
Zakaria has been repairing bicycles and motorbikes in Naivasha town for the last 10 years. He is 48 years old, married to Ruth Nduku and they have 2 children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more spare parts for his shop.

In the future, Zakaria hopes to open a bigger motorcycle repair shop and also be a supplier of spare parts to other repair shops within Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Edith Tsindoli

texts.en:
Edith K. is 41 years old. She is married to Buxton K. who is an electrician. They have two children, Joseph 28 years old in the university and Joash who is 20 years old and in secondary school. They live in an area that is not far from Vihiga town.

Edith has been running an auto spares shop selling car paints and spare parts as well for the past 11 years. Her clients mainly consist of motor vehicle mechanics and local motorists who come to buy spare parts and car paints as well as items that can be of use in the motor vehicles from her. She is in need of money to enable her to buy motor spare parts and paints to add to her stock. That is why she applied to get a loan in KADET.

Her desire is to establish a full auto spare parts shop and also open up a garage. She also hopes to give back to the society by educating orphans in her village.

loans.use: To buy motor spare parts to add to her stock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is 38 years old, married to Joseph and has six children. She lives in Migori town.
Elizabeth has a business selling polythene bags, which are normally used in greenhouses. She has been in this business for the past nine years and is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner, KADET. She intends to use the money to buy more polythene bags to add to her stock. Her dream is to see her business grow and venture into the cattle-rearing business.

loans.use: To buy polythene bags to add to her stock

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a very caring lady. She responsibly carries out her duties as a housewife and a mother. She also has a business selling goats, which she started a few years ago to help her husband financially. The business has earned her a good profit and she easily pays the utilities expenses. She is the mother of four children, two sons and two daughters. Her first two children are enrolled in school and are in the 4th and 3rd class. The other two are too young to attend school. 

Razia is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. 
Her husband’s name is G. A. and he is a tractor driver. He drives a tractor in the fields and also uses it for loading items. He loads different items, such as fruits and vegetables, and drops them at their designated places. 

Razia has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her animal selling business. With the loan, she will buy goats to increase her sales. She sells goats mainly to butcher shops. She is hopeful that her decision of getting a loan and investing it in her business will be profitable for her family, and that she will be able to repay the loan without any problems. She is a new loan applicant and hopes that it will be a good experience for her. 

In the photo, Razia is the lady who is holding the book (called an Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Rafiqaan's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqaan lives in a small city in Pakistan called Jaranwala, which is famous for its agricultural industry. Rafiqaan has been living here with her family for the last 12 years in a 3-room brick house.

She is 40 years old and married to 45 year old G. S. who works in the field. He grows crops like wheat and rice in the fields. He works very hard to put three meals on the table for his family. Rafiqaan supports her family financially by operating a grocery shop adjacent to her home.

She has given birth to three daughters who are still very young and are below 10 years of age. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her grocery business. With the loan, she will buy groceries for her grocery shop and is hopeful that this investment will result in good profit for her and that her family’s financial condition will improve. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Rafiqaan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery business

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and is famous for its agriculture industry.  A caring lady, Maqsoodan carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and takes care of her children at home. She lives in a 2-room brick house with her family. Her family consists of four children, her husband and herself.

She is married to R. A., who has a dairy business. He keeps some buffalos at home to get milk from them for selling to his customers.  Maqsoodan helps him in getting milk and in taking care of his buffalos.

She has 3 sons and a daughter. Two of them work and the younger ones attend school. Her eldest son works in the fields as well as work in a factory. The one next to him also works in a factory for a meager income. They contribute to their family financially from their earnings. 

Maqsoodan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo for his dairy business. The additional buffalo will help him to serve more customers and to earn more income. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In her previous loan year, she has built good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Zeenat's Group

texts.en:
Zeenat has been living with her family in Jaranwala, Pakistan for the last 14 years. Jaranwala city is located in Punjab province and is famous for its agricultural industry.  She is married to M. A. and has 5 sons. Her husband has a business selling popcorn. He operates his business from a four-wheeled cart and sells popcorn by going to different areas of the city.

All of her sons remain uneducated because Zeenat and her husband don't have the financial resources which allow them to send their kids to school and bear their education expenses. Her eldest son started working at an early age. He learned the art of sewing from Zeenat and now he runs a tailoring shop in the market and offers his tailoring services to his customers.

Zeenat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a new popcorn making machine which will make better quality popcorn and earn him more income.  She is hopeful that her husband will have good experiences in his job and get good benefits from his business after this loan investment.

She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her family. 

Note: In this photo, the lady who holds the book (an Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Zeenat.

loans.use: To buy a popcorn making machine for popcorn selling business

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is famous for its agricultural industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family. 

A talented lady, Yasmeen owns and operates her dairy business at home. She has a buffalo from which she gets milk that she sells to her community to earn an income for her family. She takes care of her buffalo by providing timely food and water.
  
Her husband operates a laundry business in the market where he washes his customers' clothes. Yasmeen has four children and all are getting their education. She works very hard to pay their school fees. She wants them to complete their education and become successful in their lives. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her dairy business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo to increase the quantity of milk available for selling to more people. She has been doing this business for the past five years and is hopeful that she will get the desired results from this loan investment.
  
She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Yasmeen.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her dairy business

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Nasira lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family. She is married to M. S., who works in the fields growing rice and wheat crops. 

Nasira supports her family financially by operating a milk-selling business. She has a buffalo at her home. She spends her day by getting up early in the morning, finishing the household responsibilities and getting milk from her buffalo. She sells milk to her community and earns good income from it. Her earnings allow her to manage the utilities expenses.  

She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her first two kids are studying and the other two are too young to attend school. 

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her milk-selling business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo to get more milk to serve more clients. She has been in this business for the last five years and is confident that she will be successful in getting more profit after making the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she developed good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Nasira.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Angela Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Angela es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, y está muy a gusto con el banco ya que las socias son muy unidas y le encanta las charlas educativas. Tiene 21 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene un hermoso pequeñito de 2 años de edad. Su marido trabaja en un tanquero.
 
Es comerciante, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ofrece sus productos a las personas que habitan por su sector, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana en las tardes ya que en las tardes su suegra le cuida el bebe. Los productos los compra en Guayaquil, ciudad a la que viaja una vez al mes y a veces dos veces de acuerdo a lo que venda o pedidos que tenga.

Este crédito es para realizar un viaje a Guayaquil a comprar más mercadería. Su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que donde vive es la casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Los Corrales" meets every two weeks in the community of Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi. It is a community made up of individuals of various occupations, such as: artisans and merchants.

Angela is the founding member of the community bank and she is very happy with the group, especially because they are a much unified group who enjoy the educational talks. She is 21 years old and she lives with her partner, and together they have a beautiful 2-year old baby. Her husband is a transport driver. 

She is a merchant, selling all types of clothing. She carries out her sales door to door in her neighborhood. She completes her sales on credit, collecting weekly payments. She works four days a week in the afternoons, when her mother-in-law takes care of the baby. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil once or twice per month depending on her sales and the orders she receives. 

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise while on another trip to Guayaquil. Her dream is to have a house of her own. She currently lives with her parents in law.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Adriana Jessenia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Adriana tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 9-6 y dos años, los mayores están en la escuela lo cual representa muchos gastos, el marido es chofer y con esto muchas veces no le alcanza para los gastos de la familia.

Por esta razón ella decidió dedicarse al comercio, vende ropa puerta a puerta. Además los sábados y domingos vende comida en su casa donde ella en estos días pone un pequeño comedor,  nos cuenta que la situación esta dura pero con trabajo y esfuerzo ellos la han sabido llevar. Lo que es ropa la deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, viaja a Guayaquil una vez al mes a traer mercadería.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mercadería y cuatro sillas plásticas para el negocio de comida. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio y le  gusta porque gracias a esto ha podido incrementar sus ventas. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijos y tener su casa bien arreglada.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Los Corrales" meets every two weeks in the community of Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi. It is a community made up of individuals of various occupations, such as: artisans and merchants.

Adriana is 24 years old, she is married and she has three children, aged 9, 6 and 2 years. The two eldest are attending school and it is very expensive. Her husband is a driver and his income is often not enough to cover the family's expenses. 

For this reason she decided to sell clothing from door to door. On Saturdays and Sundays she also sells foods from a small restaurant in her home. She says that her situation is very difficult but with their hard work and effort they have managed to pull through. She sells her clothing items on credit, collecting weekly payments. She travels to Guayaquil one a month to purchase merchandise. 

This loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise and four plastic chairs for her restaurant business. She has been a member of this community bank since the beginning and she enjoys it because she has seen an improvement in her sales. Her dream is to give her children and education and a well conditioned house.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale and four plastic chairs.

loans.name: Magdalena De Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora magdalena es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta en el mismo ya que ha hecho nuevas amistades y también porque en la institución ha encontrado una mano amiga que le ayuda con los créditos. Tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo 4 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad, la menor esta en colegio y vive con ella aun. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Se dedica a la venta de zapatos y bisutería, vende en su casa y también lleva a entregar los productos que sus clientes le piden, vende al contado y también deja a crédito pero solo en dos pagos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 15h00, su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil una vez al mes ya que allá hay más variedad y sale más barato.

Este crédito es para comprar mas mercadería. Sus sueños son mejorar su casa y construir un cuarto adecuado para su local.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Los Corrales" meets every two weeks in the community of Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi. It is a region where the population has various occupations, including: artisan and general merchant. 

Magdalena is the founding member of the community bank and she is very happy with the group because she has made new friends. The organization has also helped her find a new friend who assists her with her loans. She is 43 years old and she lives with her partner and their four children. Three of her children are grown and the youngest is in school and still lives at home.  Her husband is a merchant. 

She sells jewelry and shoes from her home and she also delivers to clients who have placed orders. She completes her sales in cash and credit, but she only permits two payments as terms of her credit sales.   She works from 9am to 3pm and she purchases her merchandise from the city of Guayaquil once per month. She finds greater variety and better prices in the city. 

Her loan will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise. Her dream is to improve her home and to build a fourth room to accommodate her business.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and jewelry.

loans.name: Johanna Beatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecrist,i ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Johanna, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y  de esta linda relación tiene un hermoso bebe de un año y dos meses, lo que para ella es lo mejor de su vida junto a su esposo,  el mismo que trabaja en la fabril en Manta.

Es una ama de casa que se dedica al hogar y de lleno a su bebe que requiere de muchos cuidados, nos cuenta que la situación con la llegada de su bebe se les ha puesto difícil es por eso que quiere poner un  negocio de venta de ropa, aprovechando que su suegra le va a ayudar en el cuidado de su hijo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mercadería para así empezar con su negocio de venta de ropa, en estos días piensa viajar con una amiga a Guayaquil para comprar su mercadería. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado por la facilidad para conseguir el crédito.

Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia ya que vive en la casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Los Corrales" meets every two weeks in the community of Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi. It is a region where the populations have various occupations, including: artisan and general merchant. 

Johanna is 26 years old. She is married and from this beautiful relationship came a beautiful 14-month old baby boy. For her this is the best part of life, living together with her husband.  He works in the La Fabril company in Manta. 

She is a housewife who takes care of her home and her baby who needs so much of her. She says that since the arrival of their baby the situation has been difficult which is why she wants to start a clothing business. Her mother in law has offered to care for the baby. 

This loan will be used to purchase merchandise to start up her business. She's plans on traveling to Guayaquil with a friend these days to make her purchases. This is her first loan with her community bank. She enjoys being a member for the ability to access loans. 

Her dream is to have a house of her own. They currently live with her parents in law.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Fátima María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

Para la señora Fátima el tiempo ha pasado muy rápido en el Banco Comunal, nos dice que parece que fue ayer que inicio aquí y ya son 4 ciclos en los cuales ha crecido en su vida personal  ya que ha aprendido mucho a través de las charlas educativas. Tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 10-8-y 6 años los mismos que estudian en la escuela. Su marido tiene el negocio de transporte a Montecristi en una camioneta.

Es comerciante, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ofrece sus productos a las personas que habitan por su sector, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana en las mañanas ya que en las tardes tiene que ayudar a sus hijos en sus tareas. Los productos los compra en Guayaquil, ciudad a la que viaja una vez al mes y a veces dos veces de acuerdo a lo que venda o pedidos que tenga.

Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Los Corrales" meets every two weeks in the community of Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi. It is a region where the population has various occupations, including: artisan and general merchant. 

For Fatima time has passed very quickly. She has been a member of her community bank for the past 4 loan cycles and it feels like yesterday when she first joined. She has grown in her personal life and she has learned a great deal through the educational talks. She is 31 years old, she is married and she has 3 children, aged 10, 8, and 6 years old. They are all going to school. Her husband is in the transport business in Montecristi, using a minivan.  

She is a merchant who sells all types of clothing door to door. She offers her products to the members of her community. She completes her sales in cash and credit, collecting weekly payments. She works four days a week in the mornings and in the afternoons she helps her children with their homework. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil. She travels there once or twice per month depending on her sales and the orders she receives. 

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise. Her dream is to have a house of her own. She lives with her mother.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Henry Aurelio

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí encontramos a Henry, este es su segundo ciclo en el banco y esta muy contento ya que nos dice que ha sido muy fácil para el conseguir el crédito lo que no sucede con otras instituciones que ponen muchas trabas para los créditos. El esta casado y de esta relación tiene un pequeño hijo de 1 año y seis meses que su mas grande ilusión. Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 19h00, esta tienda la puso con unos pocos ahorros que tenía hace 4 años, en la actualidad la tiene un poco mas surtida ya que lo que va obteniendo en ganancias lo va invirtiendo en su negocio. Los productos los compra en  Manta y Portoviejo.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos para surtir más su tienda y así poder obtener más ganancias. Su sueño es tener una gran tienda para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Los Corrales Communal Bank meets every two weeks in a town called Los Corrales. It is a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture. Most of the inhabitants of this town carry out different business activities such as handicrafts and general commerce.

Henry is in his in his second cycle with the bank, and he is very happy.  He tell us that it has been very easy to get the loan, which does not happen with other institutions that work a lot with loans.

He is married, and he has a one year and six months old child.  His child is his greatest thrill.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores.

He has a small grocery store.  He works every day from 5:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  He established the store with the few savings that he had for four years.  The store is currently a little better stocked.  As he gets income he invests it in his business.  He buy his products in Manta and Portoviejo.

He will use this loan to buy products to stock his store more.  That way he will be able to get more income.

His dream is to have a large store in order to give his family the best.

loans.use: To buy general supplies

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

Para la señora Martha este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal, le gusta por la seriedad tanto de sus compañeras como de la institución ya que reciben los créditos a tiempo y lo que necesitan. Ella tiene 53 años de edad, esta casada y de esta relación tuvo 4 hijos, tres ya mayores y una jovencita de 17 años que es la que vive con ella y  aun estudia en el colegio. Su esposo es comerciante de frutas en  el mercado de Manta.

Tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa el cual atiende los sábados y domingos desde las 7am hasta las 18h00, el plato que más vende es la cuajada (caldo que sale de la preparación del queso). Su hija le ayuda en esto ya que su esposo trabaja todos los días en su negocio de ventas de frutas y verduras.

Este crédito es la mitad para el negocio de la comida para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos y la otra parte para el negocio del esposo. Su sueño es tener un local más grande.
texts.en:
The Los Corrales communal bank meets every 15 days in a place called Los Corrales, a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture. In this area, the majority of the people have different businesses such as handicrafts and general commerce.

For Martha, this is her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes the reliability of both her fellow group members and the lending institution because they receive the loans on time and receive what they need. Martha is 53 years old, married, and has four children with her husband. Three of her children are already older and her 17-year-old daughter still lives with her and is in high school. Her husband is a fruit salesman at the Manta market.

She has a small dining area in her house which she attends to on Saturdays and Sundays from 7am to 6pm. The dish that she sells the most is cuajada (a curd made from preparing cheese). Her daughter helps her with this since her husband works every day at his fruit and vegetable business.

Half of the loan is for the food business to purchase products to make the dishes, and the other part is for her husband’s business. Her dream is to have a larger place for her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Nilda Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Nilda, tiene 41 años de edad,  está casada y tienen dos hijos de 13 y 5 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y el otro en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en la Fabril en Manta.
 
Se dedica al comercio, vende  pollos por libras o enteros, tiene un local en el mercado de Tarqui en Manta. Trabaja los viernes, sábados y domingos, desde las 5am hasta las 13h00, los pollos los compra en una granja que está cerca de su casa lo cual facilita la compra y selección de los pollos, luego los traslada hasta su local para venderlos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más pollos porque a veces le hacen falta y un congelador para dejar los pollos hasta el otro día cuando no los pueda vender todos. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda recibida.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando como hasta ahora y poder comprar un carro.
texts.en:
The Los Corrales community bank meets every two weeks in a town called Los Corrales which is a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture.  The inhabitants of this town carry out a number of different business activities such as handicrafts and general commerce.

This is where we find Nilda who is 41 years old, married and has two children aged 13 and 5.  The eldest child is in high school and the other is in elementary school.  Her husband works for the company La Fabril in the town of Manta.

Nilda sells chickens by the pound or whole.  She has a stall in the Tarqui market in Manta.  She works Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 5.00am to 1.00pm.  She buys the chickens in a farm near her home which makes it possible for her to buy and select chickens.  She then takes them to her stall to sell.

This loan will be used to purchase more chickens because sometimes she doesn't have enough and a freezer in which she can leave the chickens for another day when she can't sell them all.  She has been a member of the community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because of the support she has received.

Her dreams are to continue working as she has up until now and to be able to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy chickens and a freezer

loans.name: Letty Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Letty nos cuenta con mucho orgullo que ella es socio fundadora del Banco Comunal y que además esta muy contenta ya que ha crecido y por la ayuda que les ha brindado la institución a todas las socias. Tiene 41 años de edad y está casada hace 25 años de la cual ha tenido dos hijos de 25 y 17 años, él menor vive con ellos y estudia en colegio. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella tiene un comedor en el sector donde ella vive, trabaja de viernes a domingo desde las 8 am hasta las 15h00, prepara el delicioso encebollado de pescado que es un plato muy solicitado por los habitantes del sector y de la provincia, su hijo le ayuda cuando tiene tiempo libre.
 
Este crédito es para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos, además de dos mesas y 8 sillas que le hacen falta ya que a veces los clientes se van por no tener donde sentarse. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y que su hijo sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The Los Corrales community bank meets every two weeks in a town called Los Corrales which is a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture.  The inhabitants of this town carry out a number of different business activities such as handicrafts and general commerce.

Letty tells us with a lot of pride that she is one of the founding members of the community bank and that she is very happy because it has helped her to grow her business and because the bank has helped all its members.  She is 41 years old and has been married for 25 years.  She has two children aged 25 and 17.  The youngest lives with her and is in school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Letty has a small restaurant in the neighborhood where she lives.  She works Friday through Sunday from 8.00am to 3.00pm.  She prepares fish and onion stew which is the most popular dish amongst the locals in her neighborhood and region.  Her son helps her when he has any spare time.

This loan will be used to buy products for preparing her food, as well as two tables and eight chairs which she needs because sometimes her customers don't have anywhere to sit.  Her dreams are to have a big restaurant and for her child to be a professional.

loans.use: To buy (food) supplies, two tables and eight chairs

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecrist,i ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Diana, ella tiene 20 años de edad, esta casada y de esta reciente y linda unión tiene un hermoso pequeñito de un año y cuatro meses que es su mas bello tesoro. Su esposo es comerciante.

El crédito que ella realiza es para el negocio de su esposo. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de tagua (producto que se utiliza para fabricar botones y otras muchas variedades de productos) él se desplaza hasta los campos donde consigue este producto mas barato, los transporta hasta Manta donde las vende a comerciantes de allá que lo exportan a otros países y también les vende a los fabricantes de botones en Colorado. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 7am hasta las 16h00.

Este crédito es para comprar mas tagua ya que quiere aprovechar que esta está a muy buen precio en el mercado. Su sueño es comprar un camioncito para que su esposo realice su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Los Corrales community bank meets every two weeks in a town called Los Corrales which is a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture.  The inhabitants of this town carry out a number of different business activities such as handicrafts and general commerce.

Here we find Diana who is 20 years old, married, and from this recent and beautiful union she has a lovely little boy who is 16 months old and is her perfect treasure.  Her husband is a merchant.

The loan she is requesting is for her husband's business.  He buys and sells 'tagua' (a type of 'vegetable ivory' which is used for making buttons and many other types of products).  He travels to the countryside where he can obtain the product cheaper then transports it to Manta where he sells it to merchants who export it to other countries and also sell it to button manufacturers in Colorado.  He works from Monday to Friday from 7.00am to 4.00pm.

This loan will be used to buy more 'tagua' since he wants to take advantage of the fact that it is selling for a good price in the market.  Diana's dream is to be able to buy a small truck so that her husband can carry out his work.

loans.use: To buy 'tagua' (vegetable ivory)

loans.name: Neyci Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

Para la señora Neyci este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y esta muy a gusto ya que gracias a los créditos ha podido mejorar su negocio. Ella tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unió libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad. Su marido es chofer profesional.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 19h00, lleva con su negocio ya 7 años, en la actualidad y con la ayuda de los créditos la tiene un poco mas surtida, ahora también vende medicinas y productos de bazar lo que le da mejores ganancias. Los productos los compra e Manta y Portoviejo y en algunos casos los recibe en su local.
 
Este crédito es para seguir surtiendo aun más su tienda y así tener de todo ya que sus clientes le piden muchas cosas y no quiere defraudarlos.  Su sueño es tener lo mejor posible su tienda ya que es su mas grande devoción.
texts.en:
The Los Corrales community bank meets every two weeks in a town called Los Corrales which is a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture.  The inhabitants of this town carry out a number of different business activities such as handicrafts and general commerce.

This is Neyci's third loan cycle with the community bank and she very happy because thanks to the loans she has been able to improve her business.  She is 47 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has 3 grown-up children.  Her husband is a professional driver.

Neyci has a small convenience store.  She works every day from 5.00am to 7.00pm.  She has been running her business for 7 years.  Currently, and with the help of the loans she has had, she has it a little better stocked.  She also now sells medicines and a range of other goods which provide her with better profits.  She buys her products in Manta and Portoviejo and in some cases she receives them at her shop.

This loan will be used to continue stocking her store even more so that it has as many products as possible available since her customers ask her for a lot of things and she doesn't want to let them down.  Her dream is to improve her store as much as possible since it is her big passion.

loans.use: To buy provisions, medicines and other goods for her store

loans.name: Tania Gabriela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía.

La señora Tania tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un lindo bebe de un año y siete meses de nacido. Su marido es comerciante. Para ella este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta ya que gracias a los créditos a podido ayudar a su marido con el negocio ya que es para el bien de ella y su familia.

El crédito que ella realiza es para el negocio de su esposo. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de tagua (producto que se utiliza para fabricar botones y otras muchas variedades de productos) él se desplaza hasta los campos  en otras ciudades donde consigue este producto más barato, los transporta hasta Manta donde las vende a comerciantes de allá que lo exportan a otros lugares. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 6am hasta las 17h00.

Este crédito es para comprar más tagua ya que quiere aprovechar que está a muy buen precio en el mercado. Sus sueños son comprar una casa  ya que viven en la casa de sus suegros y también un carro.
texts.en:
The Los Corrales community bank meets every two weeks in a town called Los Corrales which is a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture.  The inhabitants of this town carry out a number of different business activities such as handicrafts and general commerce.

Tania is 19 years old and lives with her partner.  They have a beautiful 19 month-old baby.  Her husband is a merchant.  This is Tania's third loan cycle with the community bank and she is very happy since, thanks to the loans, she has been able to help her husband with his business which is for the good of her and her family.

The loan which she is requesting is for her husband's business.  He buys and sells 'tagua' (a type of 'vegetable ivory' which is used for making buttons and many other types of products).  He travels to the countryside where he can obtain the product cheaper, he transports it to Manta where he sells it to merchants who export it to other countries.  He works from Monday to Friday from 6.00am to 5.00pm.

This loan will be used to buy more 'tagua' since he wants to take advantage of the fact that it is selling for a good price in the market.  Tania's dreams are to buy a house, since she lives with her in-laws, and also to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy 'tagua' (vegetable ivory)

loans.name: Leticia Emperatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecrist,i ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Leticia, ella tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 15- 8 y 6 años los mismos que están en escuela y colegio, su marido trabaja en una fábrica de harina de pescado.

Es un ama de casa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar puso hace apenas seis meses una tienda, en ella utilizo todos sus recursos para la adecuación y arreglos del lugar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 19h00, los productos los adquiere en Portoviejo ya que allá le salen más baratos. Trabaja sola ya que sus hijos están pequeños, le gusta su trabajo por que así esta con sus hijos y puede ayudarlos en las tares y al mismo tiempo gana su dinero.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar productos para surtir más su tienda. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y esta muy contenta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
The Los Corrales Communal Bank meets every two weeks in a town called Los Corrales. It is a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture.  Most of the inhabitants of this town carry out different business activities such as handicrafts.

This is where we find 28 year old Leticia.  She is a married and has three children.  The children are 15, 8, and 6 years old.  They attend elementary school and high school.  Leticia’s husband works in a fishmeal factory.

She is a housewife who set up a store just six months ago to help with the household expenses.  She uses all of her resources in order to make adjustments and repairs on her place.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She gets her products in Portoviejo because they are cheaper there.  She works alone because her children are little.  She likes her work because she is with her children.  She can help them with their school work while making money at the same time.

She will use this loan to buy products to better stock her store.  This is her first cycle in the communal bank, and she is very happy with the ease of obtaining loans.

Her dream is to have her own house because she lives in her mother’s house.

loans.use: To buy general supplies

loans.name: Achraf

texts.en:
Achraf is a 30-year-old married man and the father of three children. Since 2008 he has been working in painting wood for living rooms, bedrooms and dining rooms, with 15 years of experience in the field. 

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay school fees, in addition to buying diesel fuel to use for heat in the winter season. His previous loans had a good impact on his business and his family income, and on both his social and financial situations. With the last loan, he bought a Renault Rapid car suitable for his business, to transport his tools and to deliver his finished work in a short period of time. 

He is working on expanding his business, and hoping to invest everything he has in making it happen.

loans.use: To pay school fees and buy diesel fuel for the winter

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok P. is a 48-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. He is married to Mrs. Thoun, age 38. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to three children, all of whom are single. 

He owns a big farm that he inherited from his grandmother. Currently, he wants to feed more pigs and he hopes to sell them to buyers four months after he begins raising them. To help solve this problem, he has requested a loan of $1100 that he will use to buy more pigs and sacks of pig feed to earn more profit.

Mr. Sok P. was not available, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and sacks of pig feed to earn more profits.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nita L., 34, lives in Khogana Dobato, one of the developing villages in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Including herself, there are three persons in her family. Her husband is Mr. Kamal L., who works in a noodle factory. Her son is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. L. opened her gift shop three years ago to improve her family's standard of living, because her husband's income alone is not enough to run the family smoothly. She sells various types of gift items in her shop. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 NPR to buy different types of gift items for her business.

loans.use: to buy different types of gift items for her shop

loans.name: Ram Kumari

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Ram Kumari K..  She is married and has 3 children aged 18,13 and 11.  In 2000, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supoorts her family.   In the future, Ram Kumari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mansu

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Mansu B..  She is married and has 2 children aged 13 abd 10.  In 2002, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchased grocery goods.  In the future, Mansu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

 In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.
