The extra income from this loan will help improve the living standards of the family. His biggest challenges have been lack of food storage facilities and the high cost of artificial insemination services. He says that in the next five years, he plans to have six dairy cows and be the main milk supplier to the local market. He says that with the previous loan he got he has been able to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Edwin Kiplagat

texts.en:
Edwin is forty-five years old, married to Ann M., and they have been blessed with three children aged 17, 15 and 11 years respectively. Edwin has been in the business of buying and selling cows for the last two years and from his income, he has been able to bring up his children and even send them to good schools.

He joined Kadet after he was introduced by an existing member. With this loan he plans to buy more cows and then sell them at a profit at the nearby centre where he has been operating. He is well known at the centre and he gets many calls from customers who are willing to buy from him or to sell him cows.

His future plan is to buy a plot at the centre and develop it in order to enable him to earn a living and educate all his children.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for resale

loans.name: Faina

texts.en:
Faina is 28 years old, married with two children; the first one is 4 years old and the younger one is one year old. Faina is a businesswoman however her husband is a mason. This family works hard for the purpose of progressing quickly in their activities.  In particular, Faina owns a business selling various styles of clothes and she has an experience of 10 years in her business. In that period, she has employed one person  from her community as a helper.

Faina is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more bales of clothes.  With this loan she will be able to attract more customers which is the best way of earning more profits.

loans.use: Purchasing additional clothes for sale

loans.name: Paul Owino

texts.en:
Paul Owino O., age 32, is an electrician and electronic technician. He is known for repairing electronics and fixing electrical cables. He is applying for his first loan from Kadet Ltd after being introduced by a friend who is a client here. He intends to use the money to buy some electronic parts to add to his stock. This will enable him serve his clients better.
 
Paul's secondary business is the sale of cereals. With the profits expected from this loan, he hopes to expand this business as well as to buy materials for his electronic repair business.

Paul and his wife, Joan Atieno, have four children. They live in the town of Migori.

loans.use: To buy tools for his electrical and electronic repair business

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin S., age 31, has a brick-making business that he has been running for the past three years. Over this time, he has built up a large clientele. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced to us by a friend who is a client here. He wants to buy materials for making the bricks as well as to purchase timber for building a shade for his bricks. His monthly income is Kshs 4,200. He intends to use the profits to buy a grade cow to be used to supply milk to the nearby shops.

His desire is to be able to build rental houses to boost his business.

Martin and his wife, Beryl Achieng, have six children. They live in the town of Migori.

loans.use: To buy brick-making materials

loans.name: C1240 Rwambona 4 Group

texts.en:
Venant is 50 years old, married with eight children who are between 7 and 21 years old.  Venant is the leader of a group called 'Rwambona' and this group is commonly known in the business of selling milk.  Venant and his team have been in this business for about 6 years and the  hours of their business are from 8 am to 6 pm every day.

Although Venant and his team have been in this business for about 6 years, their capital is still too low to expand meaningfully.  To change this, they need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company which will allow them to purchase a dairy machine.  If this machine is bought, there will be a big increase of liters of milk to sell per day.  If successful, this team hopes that they will earn more profits than previously and in addition to that, they will keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: the purchase of a dairy machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: retail store inventory; chicken feed

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen H. lives in Lchashen village, Sevan area, with his parents, his wife and two children. 

For about 15 years Armen has engaged in land cultivation and animal husbandry. In his farm he has cows, sheep, pigs, and chickens. Armen’s wife helps him in farming, so they support their family, develop their farm and pay for their children's education at university. 

Armen asks for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy potato seedlings, which he will plant next spring.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 28-year-old single man, working as a plumber for the past 9 years. Rabih takes on several construction projects; he is a man with a good experience in such a field. 

Rabih is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy the necessary tools for a future project, in addition to cover what’s left of his wedding costs. Rabih’s clients are his friends, neighbors, relatives and builders. He hopes to expand his business through buying improved tools and to open a construction company of his own.

loans.use: To buy the necessary tools for a future project

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman G. N. is thirty-one years old and married. His wife assists him in running their shop. They do not have any children yet. His business is located at Mukuru kwa Njenga and he is served by the Kitengela branch. He sells assorted items in his shop including bread, milk, sodas, soap, sweets, ornaments, and detergents. He has been in this business for three years and has one employee. 

He says that the business is profitable. He serves the local people. He says that his major challenge is financial constraints and the fact that there are too many other people in the area doing the same kind of business as his and so customers are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy broilers (chickens) to supply to nearby restaurants to expand his business while taking care of his customers' demands. He hopes that in future, he will be able to diversify into the real estate business. He describes himself as hardworking and business-oriented.

loans.use: Broilers

loans.name: Alikisima United Group-Jinja

texts.en:
B. Pheibe is 35 years old and a mother of four children. Pig husbandry and fire wood sales have been her means of livelihood for the last four years in Ivunamba-Jinja. She was previously a dairy farmer. 

There was a need to elevate her finances and she figured the above trades would help her achieve that goal. She earns 120,000 shillings for her business on a weekly basis. With this loan, she wants to purchase more fire wood to supply to her clients.

Pheibe belongs to Alikisima United group in Jinja.

loans.use: To purchase more fire wood

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes was born in 1987 and is married without any children yet. Agnes is the one who works in her family. The reason why she has to work hard for the purpose of expanding her business is that she is the breadwinner. Agnes owns a small business with various products and this kind of business is profitable because right now she is able to sort out her family problems through her business. Agnes has an experience of three years and the hours of her daily activities are from 7 AM to 8 PM.		

Agnes is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more products needed by her customers. With her expansion; Agnes will be able to earn enough profits for expanding her business and for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing additional products

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 49 years old and married with 11 children between the ages of 7 and 30. Nine of her children are currently attending school. Lucy is a member of the Yuya Mulembe group which is funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. She has been farming for seven years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces milk, vegetables, and eggs which she sells to the local market. Lucy also earns income from her shop which she operates in the same area. Her biggest challenge has been poultry diseases which reduce her productivity.

Lucy has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry project. The increased income from this project will enable her send her children to good schools. She wishes to have 500 chickens and a posho mill, which is used to grind maize into flour, in the next five years.

Lucy has been pictured with her dairy cows because it was not possible to take her picture at her poultry farm.

loans.use: to expand her poultry project

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy different kinds of threads and cloth

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann W. M. is 28 years old and married with two children who are 12 and 14. Her husband is a driver. Ann has a business making and selling table clothes, covers, bedspreads, and curtains. She also repairs garments for her local customers. Ann’s business is located at Mukuru Kwa Njenga and she is served by the Kitengela branch. Ann has been in this business for ten years and her business is profitable. 

Ann’s major challenges are financial constraints and competition. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well and describes herself as hardworking, God-fearing, and business-minded. Ann will use her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more materials and thread to expand her business and meet customer demand. Ann hopes to be able to export her products in the future. She also sees herself owning a plot of land on which her family can build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more materials and thread

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie was born in 1967 and she is married with one child.  Anastasie is a businesswoman who is commonly known in the business of selling beer in her pub.  She has owned a pub where she sells beer for about six years.  Her pub is open from 6 am to 9 pm every day.

Anastasie is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing a variety of beer in her pub.  With this additional quantity of beer, she will satisfy the demand of her customers and her profits will increase more than previously.  If successful, she will keep reinvesting for a better financial stability in her future.

loans.use: Expanding her business through purchasing a lot of beer for her pub

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 52-year-old married man, father of three children. Ghassan works as a mobile fruit & vegetable dealer. He moves from one village to another to sell his products. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a Renault Rapid car necessary for expanding his business region. 

Ghassan is well organized and a man with a good reputation. His clients like dealing with him because his products are very fresh & tasty. He hopes to expand his business through opening a wholesale storage.

loans.use: To buy a Renault Rapid car necessary for expanding his business

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school while three have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and transport costs.

She operates an agrovet shop selling cattle farm products, neighbours and passersby being her potential customers. Loice faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to build rental houses in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu because of low interest rates and diverse favorable products.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to move her business forward

loans.name: Nuela

texts.en: Nuela S. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Nuela is 28 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has three children but only one out of her children goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia P. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, beans, rice and fish  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice to sell.  Emelia is 46 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant farmer. She has seven children and five of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and high transport costs.

She has operated a retail shop for over two years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she operates a tailoring shop as her other source of income. Faith faces a challenge of defaults in payments of goods by those who purchase on credit and also high cost of transporting goods to her place of operations.

She decided to join Yehu because of the availability of diverse products. With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Topister

texts.en:
Topister is 25 years old. She is married with three children who are between the ages of 1 and 8. Two of the children are currently attending school. She is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has has been farming for one year. She also runs a charcoal business in a nearby market. Her farm currently produces eggs only which she sells at the local market. She says her biggest problem has been poultry diseases.

She recently repaid her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 KES and has requested this loan of 50,000 KES to expand her poultry project. She says the proceeds from this project will go a long way in the education of her children who are in a private school. She says that in future, she would like to expand her farm size to accommodate at least two dairy cows.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina operates a business buying & selling frozen foods. She started this business only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to obtain a loan. The business is a big help for the family in covering their expenses and allows them to set aside savings for the future. The couple is requesting a new loan of PhP 20,000 to buy additonal inventory of frozen foods to sell. The proceeds of her business give her money to support the immediate and basic needs of her family. 

Carina hopes that her business will become successful someday. She wishes also to engage in more businesses that will provide her family a supplementary income thus augment her husband’s income. Along with the business success she is dreaming about is the hope to see the graduation of her two children at college level and to see them find a stable job. Carina wants to thank ASHI/Kiva lenders who are supporting this loan. That is one of the greatest chances for her to begin reaching for her goals.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Urozali

texts.ru: Халилов Урозали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 59 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Двое сыновей работают в России. Сам Урозали вместе с семьей занимаются растениеводством. Кроме того он разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. В этой области уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Urozali H. lives in the Yavan district.  He is 59 years old, married and has 6 children.  Two of his sons work in Russia.  Urozali and his family are involved in agriculture.  Besides this, he also breeds livestock at home.  He primarily fattens up and sells livestock.  Urozali has been in this business for 20 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and transportation costs.

He has operated his Phoso mill (maize grinding machine) business for over six years. Samuel faces a challenge of high costs of fuel for the maize grinding machine. He hopes to open another Posho mill business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase a bale of clothes to start a clothes selling business. Samuel decided to join Yehu because of its favorable interest rates and sustainable loans products.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes to start selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for five years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces maize and beans which are all sold locally. He also operates a butcher shop in the same region. (He is pictured in his butcher shop).

James is 34 years old. He is married and has two children who attend school.

He has requested this loan of 45,000KES, through Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Som of the milk from this dairy cow will be used for domestic consumption and the rest, he will sell. The extra income from this loan will help to pay school fees for his children. His biggest challenge has been lack of enough funds for business expansion, thus leading to low profits. He hopes to progress in future and to be able to purchase a vehicle that will help to transport animals to a wide market for slaughter.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transportation costs.

For over ten years, she has operated her vegetable stall. Se also sells clothes at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. Nyamvula faces a challenge of high transportation costs incurred when transporting vegetables from the rural areas to her place of operation.  She hopes to establish a grocery shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase stock of vegetables and fruits and to expand her vegetable stall. She decided to join Yehu because of its low interest rates and friendly loan products.

loans.use: To purchase stock of vegetables, fruits and to expand her vegetable stall.

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres La Familia del barrio Villa Salvador de la ciudad de Aregua, se formo gracias a la invitación de varias de ellas de formar un nuevo grupo.
Actualmente el mismo se encuentra en el noveno ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está conformado por 18 integrantes, las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.
La señora Cristina R. es una de las integrantes y  se dedica a la venta de hierbas medicinales e invirtió el dinero en la compra de los mismos al por mayor, para el incremento de sus ventas. 
En Paraguay mucha gente consume el mate (agua caliente con hierbas medicinales, se toma en un vaso llamado guampa con yerma mate a la mañana y en ocasiones también de tarde), esta  costumbre se va heredando por generaciones y es practicada por persona adultas.
Las personas que diariamente consumen esta bebida son los clientes de la señora Cristina.
Las hierbas medicinales es un producto que tiene mucha venta y le ayuda a ella con el ingreso de su familia, y de esta manera ayuda a su familia.
texts.en:
The women’s cooperative “La Familia”, of the Villa Salvador neighborhood in the city of Aregua, was formed thanks to an invitation from several of them to form a new group.  Currently, the group finds itself in the ninth cycle in the Entrepreneurial Women’s Group Program of the Fundación Paraguaya.  The group is comprised of 18 members who carry out a variety of activities.  

Cristina R. is one of the members, and she dedicates herself to selling medicinal herbs.  She invested the money into buying these products at wholesale, in order to increase her sales.  In Paraguay, many people consume mate (hot water with medicinal herbs and yerba mate, drunk from a glass called a guampa, taken in the morning and sometimes at night).

This custom has been passed down for generations, and is practiced by adults.  The people who drink this beverage on a daily basis are Cristina’s customers.  Medicinal herbs sell very well, and help her generate income, allowing her to help her family.

loans.use: To purchase medicinal herbs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Stanslaus

texts.en: Stanslaus O. O. is forty one years old and married. His wife is a business lady and they have five children, between the ages of 4 and 15 years. Stanslaus and his wife would like to provide a quality education for each of his children to the university level. His business is located at Kibera and he is served by the Kitengela branch. He sells charcoal to the local people. He has been in this business for ten years now and has one employee. He says that the business is profitable. He says that his major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of KES 15,000 to buy charcoal to be sold to expand his business, while meeting his customers' demands. He hopes that, in future, he will be the major supplier of charcoal in Kibera. He also sees himself owning a plot of land. He describes himself as hardworking, honest and patient.

loans.use: Charcoal

loans.name: Anastancia

texts.en:
Anastancia is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for five years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces maize, bananas and nappier grass, which are all sold locally. She also owns a workshop business for carpentry and is also a tailor. Her primary challenges in farming have been lack of organized markets. Sometimes no sales are recorded and labor supply sometimes becomes a problem, leading to losses especially when the demand is high.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her pay school fees for her children and she will be able to provide her family with enough milk for their own consumption. In future, she would like to expand her business to enable her to buy a vehicle. She will use it to transport furniture from her workshop to her customers.

Anastancia is 30 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 10, who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol A. is a 59-year-old mother who cares for her three children. She is married to, Amador, a fisherman. To help to support her husband, she started her own fishing business. 

She dreams to get away from poverty. In 2007 she came across the idea of joining ASHI(Ahon Sa Hirap Inc.), which means “To Rise Up from Poverty”, and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Since her membership in the institution she has shown good performance in her credit rating (basis of loans) in order to get bigger capital for her business.

Now on her sixth loan, she has applied for a new loan amounting to PHP 30,000.00 to buy new “Skylab” (fish trap). She believes that one additional fish trap will catch more fish to gain better output. 

In the future, Mirasol hopes to establish a stall in the market where she can sell her fish. She also wants to be able to save for her children's education and to build a comfortable house for living and a happy family to live with.

loans.use: To buy new "skylab" (fish trap).

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with twelve children, seven of whom attend school while five have graduated. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and transport.  

For fifteen years, he has operated his charcoal sales business selling from his shop and as wholesale. He faces a major challenge of seasonality and high transport costs. During winter rainy season, availability of charcoal is scarce and the means of transporting charcoal to his place of business is expensive.   

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations and friendly products.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a retired primary school teacher who has been farming for 35 years in Kisii town, western Kenya. She has a mixed farm that produces milk and eggs, which are all sold locally. She has employed one farmhand from her community.

She has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This dairy cow will enable her to provide her family with enough milk for their own consumption and she will be able to get manure for her farm. She says that it has been hard to get a quality breed of cow and this has been a challenge. She also faces the challenge of lack of artificial insemination services. She plans to buy more dairy cows in future that will increase her milk production. She also wants to expand her poultry farming.

Mary is 56 years old. She is married and has 7 children, all adults. Two of the children are currently attending school.

She comments that the loans they are given are small for much improvement, otherwise there is hope for future improvement.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goats

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena M. is forty three years old, married and has six children. Her children are between the ages of 13 and 25 years old. Helena and her husband  hope to give their children a quality education to the university level. 

Her business is located at the busy Mwingi market, though she is served by the Thika branch office. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. She operates a restaurant known by the name of Corner Cafe. She has been in this business for five years and has two employees. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is high prices for food items making food unaffordable to some customers. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy food items to make food to sell to her customers. She hopes to have many restaurants in different towns in the future. She describes herself as jovial, aggressive, accountable and inquisitive.

loans.use: Flour, rice, milk, etc.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn M. is from the town of Banga. She is 36 years old. Edelyn is married. To make a living, Edelyn owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also runs a small sari-sari store where she sells snacks, soft drinks and other kinds of products.

Edelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Edelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are medical bills.

She has operated a medical clinic, administering to her community members and passersby. Everlyne faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open another medical clinic in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase medicine and admission beds for in-patients. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for her clinic and admission beds for in-patients.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine M. is a married lady. She has two children, aged twelve years old and four months old. She and her husband hope to give their children a quality education to the university level. Her business is located at the busy Mwingi market, though she is served by the thika branch office. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. 

Catherine makes curtains and clothes, as per customer orders, since she is a tailor. She has been in this business for ten years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is high prices for materials. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy materials to make more clothes to sell and to meet her customer's demands. She hopes to grow her business and to be able to make clothes to sell to many more customers. She also hopes to provide employment to many people. She sees herself building her own house. She describes herself as courageous, social and hardworking.

loans.use: Materials

loans.name: Ignance

texts.en:
Ignance was born in 1972 and is married with two children: both are 14 years old. Ignance is a businessman and his wife works as a businesswoman. Ignance owns a business selling products made from timbers. His business is well known because he employs 20 people as helpers from his community. The hours of his business are from 6 in the morning to 5 in the evening, every day except for one day of the weekend.

Ignance is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by buying more wood. With this loan, Ignance will be able to make more wooden equipment and, with this business expansion, Ignance will be able to earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy more wood for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma S. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old. Thelma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Thelma owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Thelma is just starting this business.

Thelma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Thelma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Nyabitanda Tukore Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
For eight years, Albiina K. has been running an agricultural farm where she grows bananas, maize and tea leaves from Kanyabuhama, Kihihi. With good management and customer care skills, these businesses generate a good profit of 120,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.  With hard work she looks forward to improving her banana plantation through mulching and other business improvements.

This will definitely give her ventures a new opportunity for growth as she looks at expansion. This loan will contribute to the purchase of fertilizers and mulches which will result in better yields. Her motive is to get more revenue money to pay her children’s fees and to also expand her businesses for more income.

Albiina belongs to Nyabitanda Tukore group, Kihihi.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and mulches for the plantation

loans.name: Kabungo Women, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
M. Olivia, aged 27 years, is married with a family of four children and has been operating a retail shop in Omungyenyi trading centre, Ntungamo for over 6 years. Here, she trades in a variety of products, commonly household items like sugar, salt, soap, soft drinks, water, cooking oil and much more general merchandise. She is able to earn 150,000 Ugandan shillings on a weekly basis.

Her main drawback is that she has limited a variety of products in her shop that cannot satisfy the customers' demand. Therefore, she is looking forward to increasing her stock when she gets this loan and also to expanding fully. This will help her earn more revenue and sustain her daily needs and further educate her children. 

She also belongs to 'Kabungo Women’s Group ' whose members hold each other accountable  in paying back the loan.

loans.use: purchase  more stock for the shop business

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth B. is from the town of Banga. She is 47 years old. Lilibeth is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lilibeth says all she wants is for her family to be happy and healthy.

Lilibeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is farming. 

She has operated her business of selling coconuts and brooms for over twelve years. She sells to restaurant operators, neighbours and food vendors. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to start a poultry business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase palm leaf trees and timber to renovate her house. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to uplift her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase palm leaf trees and timber for renovating her house.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith T. is from the town of Banga. She is 30 years old. Judith is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a business raising crops. primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Judith also grows pigs for fattening and sale.

Judith joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Judith is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase feed and farm supplies.

loans.name: Balikyejjusa Development Group-Mityana

texts.en:
M. Mohamed has worked painstakingly and resolutely over the last decade to make sure his alcohol brewing and sales business gives him enough wherewithal to support his family in terms of improved welfare. He has from the onset been operating this business in Namutidde-Mityana. He is married with eight children. His involvement in this business is handed down from his father's running of a similar business. 

Prior to setting forth in this business he was a farmer. In a week his business profits total up to shillings 25,000. With this loan he wants to purchase more inputs such as drums for distilling more crude alcohol that he will resell. 'Balikyejjusa' development is the group he belongs too.

loans.use: purchase of  drums, etc. for distilling more crude alcohol

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn G. is from the town of Banga. She is 44 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. 
She is engaged in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than a few years now. She also grows pigs for fattening and sale. Jocelyn was also able to open up a sari-sari store to help in their daily income. She sells biscuits, sugar and other types of products.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds, farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita’s greatest dream is to get away from the twist of poverty. In 2007 she embraced the idea of joining ASHI(Ahon Sa Hirap Inc.), means “To Rise Up from Poverty”, and KIVA partner in the Philippines. As busy entrepreneur, Anita engaged in te multiple businesses of selling charcoal, kaing (small basket) making and fishing, which allows her to save for their future. They want to enjoy towards the retirement of their life in the future and to have a happy family as well.

Now, on her fifth loan, she applied for a new loan amounting to PHP 25,000.00 for the maintenance of her kaing making, to buy inventories of charcoal to sell and to purchase additional raw materials for her fishing business such as a fishing net, bamboo and other things. This raw materials will be used to make additional “skylab” (fish traps) to catch more fish and to have sound profits. 

The couple hopes and dreams that by God’s Will, he can give them long a life to provide a better future for her family, to sustain the profitability of her businesses, and giving the best education for her 2 children.  Through hard work and determination, Anita is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial initiatives and support from ASHI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To support her multiple businesses such as selling of charcoal, kaing making and fishing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth V. is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years old. Ruth is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ruth says she wants her family to be happy and healthy.

Ruth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nyakabare Bakyar Twekundire Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
K. Victor of 'Nyakabare Bakyara Twekundire' group, Ntungamo is a hard-working and knowledgeable business-oriented man who has been running a grocery shop from Mukayenje, Rukungiri for over three years. Here he bakes bread and cakes and sells other local agricultural produce like bananas, beans and more with help from some casual labourers. 

This business has seen him bask in an average profit of 100,000 Ugandan shillings on top of his banana sales from his plantation. Therefore Victor is looking forward to restocking raw materials in his bakery business with the support of this loan money he is receiving. This will enable him to expand into large-scale production

loans.use: purchase raw materials for baking

loans.name: Elyn

texts.en:
Elyn N. is from the town of Banga. She is 28 years old. Elyn is married and has an 8-year-old child. To make a living, Elyn owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elyn also opened up a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of different products.

Elyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 8 children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (John Magayo, a brother). 

Rose has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Rose sells her products in a shop. Rose has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, cooking oil and boxes of soap. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenges for Rose include seasonality and transportation of merchandise from Kikuubo to her retail shop in Kamwokya Kifumbira.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are making profits and expanding her business to a wholesale one. Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married man and the father of 5 school-aged children. He has owned an exhaust repair shop (also selling car oil) since 2004. He repairs all types of cars. He was able, over the years, to develop his business and expand his industry operation. His work income is vital to help raise and take care of his big family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional car oils and exhaust parts at good prices. He hopes that with the new merchandise, he will meet his business needs and be in demand amongst his customers. In the future, he hopes to enlarge his shop and add new services by selling spare car parts.

loans.use: To purchase additional car oils and exhaust.

loans.name: Karen Margarita

texts.es: Karen es una joven emprendedora que tiene un hijo de 5 años y es muy reconocida en Sourdis, barrio al suroccidente de Barranquilla por su gran dinamismo y ganas de hacer  crecer  su negocio de vender mercancía variada, como ropa y calzado, que inició con un préstamo otorgado por un familiar y que ella sorprendió  y por eso buscó financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque su pequeño capital no alcanza para responder a la demanda del mercado. El credikiva es su segundo financiamiento con esta organización y con él comprará calzado, vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños  para cubrir la demanda de la temporada de Diciembre que se avecina y las familias aumentan sus gastos para verse más elegantes. Con su anterior financiamiento logró acceder a más clientes y aumentar un poco sus utilidades, de aquí su entusiasmo por hacerlo crecer, porque sueña con tener un sitio de exhibición y venta de sus productos, y con diversificar su oferta y potencializar oportunidades de nuevos mercados. Su mayor desafío es controlar la recuperación de su cartera y para ello ha tomado medidas, relacionadas con la observación previa de sus clientes nuevos, antes de entregarle la mercancía a crédito y con solo otorgar la cantidad de crédito que la gente pueda pagar.
texts.en:
Karen is an entrepreneurial woman who has one 5-year old child.  She is very well known in Sourdis, a neighborhood to the southwest of Barranquilla, for her great energy and desire to grow her business.  She sells a variety of merchandise such as clothing and shoes, a business she started with a loan from a relative.  She sought financing from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation because her small amount of capital wasn’t enough to meet market demand.

Her Kiva credit is the second loan with this organization.  She will use the funds to buy shoes, and women, men and children’s clothing.  She would like to be able to meet the demand over the upcoming December holiday season, a time when people increase their spending in order to dress up.  With her previous loan, she managed to capture more customers and increase her scope a little.  She has great enthusiasm to continue growing, and dreams of having a storefront for her products, diversifying her offerings, and tap into opportunities in new markets.

Her greatest challenge is replenishing her expenditures and, for this reason, she has taken certain defensive measures.  She carefully observes new customers’ habits before allowing any purchases on credit, or she limits these purchases to an amount the person can realistically repay.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and women's, men's and children's clothing to meet demand over the upcoming December holiday season.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel vive en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. 
 Es técnico electricista, mantenimiento de casas, trabaja en los moteles INN. de la ciudad de La Paz, y sus funciones son mantenimiento de alcantarillado, electricidad, y otros que requiera el inmueble.
Es casado y tiene dos hijos
El crédito será destinado para el pago de un anticrético de  habitación y así mejorar sus ingresos y generar ahorro, para el beneficio de su familia, y pensar a futuro incrementar su anticrético, y condiciones de habitat.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Fidel lives in the district of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. He works as an electrician, maintaining houses and motel rooms in the city of La Paz. In addition, he is in charge of plumbing and other types of building maintenance.

Fidel is married and has two children. This loan will be used to enter into an “anticrético” agreement (a special type of arrangement in which property is pawned to the tenant in exchange for an upfront rental payment, and the rent is returned to the tenant at end of the rental period). Such a contract will benefit his family since he must provide for their living conditions and guard against an increase in the cost of an “anticrético” in the future.

This is the fourth time Fidel has requested a loan from IMPRO. His credit history indicates he is a Level 1 client, which means he has completed his payments on time.

loans.use: Payment for entering into an “anticrético” rental agreement

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George C. K. is 39 years old, married and has two children, ages 12 and 5 years old. His business is located in a busy residential area of Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attractions – not forgetting the white beaches of the Indian ocean. 

George has been selling beds, cupboards and other such items to local people for the last 6 years. He says that this business is profitable and his major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more timber to expand his business. He hopes to grow his business and also hopes to give his children a quality education and own a house some day. He is a very hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres La Amistad del barrio Marambure de la ciudad de Luque, se formó mediante la señora Guillermina G. quien acompaño a su hija a retirar su crédito individual, se informó del programa del comité y decidió invitar a sus vecinas y amigas a conformar un grupo de mujeres, para que de esa forma ellas puedan acceder al crédito y poder crecer laboralmente. 
Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está conformado por 16 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Ana es una de las integrantes y presidenta del grupo, una mujer trabajadora y activa, dirige y acompaña al grupo en cada actividad que realizan para recaudar fondos para pagar las cuotas y contar con ahorros en caso de emergencia.
Su actividad consiste en vender ropas y así ayuda a su familia. La venta lo realiza  se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de prendas varias para su venta posterior.
La venta lo realiza desde su salón en su casa, pero en los días que  hay ventas ella en el local, ella sale a ofrecer en casa de conocidos, de esa manera obtener un ingreso diario ya que el mismo ayuda a la familia con los gastos de alimentación.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas para contar con mayor variedad de la temporada de primavera – verano, como camisas, blusas, remeras, shorts y otros.
texts.en:
The Friendship of Women (Mujeres La Amistad) committee in the Marambure neighborhood of the city of Luque, was formed by Guilldermina G..  She accompanied her daughter to withdraw her individual credit, found out about the committee's program, and then decided to invite her neighbors and friends to form a group of women so that they could access credit and improve productivity.

Currently, the committee is in its fifth cycle of the program for the Women Entrepreneurs Committee of the Paraguayan Foundation (Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya) and is comprised of 16 members who invest in various activities.

Ana is one of the members and president of the group.  She is an active working woman and she directs and accompanies the group in each activity undertaken, from raising funds for down payments to keeping savings in case of an emergency.

Her business is selling clothes to help out her family.  She is devoted to selling clothes and investing the money to purchase several more items for later sale.  She sells from her living room at home, but in previous days she did local sales by going to homes of acquaintances, thereby earning a daily income to help her family with food expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes to have a greater variety of styles for the spring and summer seasons, including shirts, blouses, shirts, shorts and more.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, blouses, jeans, pants, and more.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are transport costs and food. Hassan has been running his fresh water sales business and boda boda (motorcycle) business for over four years. He faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the dry summer season, less water is available and the demand is high. Hassan hopes to be a big supplier of fresh water in the future. With this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase water pipes and water taps. He decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes and water taps

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia R. is from the town of Banga. She is 57 years old. Cecilia is married. To make a living, Cecilia owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Cecilia also works hard to have savings for the family.

Cecilia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her brother's daughter). 

Mary has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Mary sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale and retail. Mary has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenge(s) for Mary include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy another plot for building more rental rooms and to own a delivery van. Mary lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her work place and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie M. is from the town of Banga. She is 19 years old. Leslie is single. She is engaged in farming and currently helps in tilling her family's rice farm. She said she had to stop going to college due to financial difficulties in her family. She is working hard to be able to save for her college education. She hopes to graduate and find a decent job so she can still help her family financially.

Leslie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leslie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Leslie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save for her college education.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man and the father of 2 school-age children. He has been working as an electrician and sanitary since 2000. He works as a traveler upon request of his clients. He is the main income provider for his family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a Rapid car to facilitate his movements instead of the unsecure motorcycle he has been using. It will be more comfortable during the winter season. He has already made some savings and he needs an additional amount to be able to purchase it. He says that he is certain that his business demand will increase because he will be able to provide faster services. In the future, he hopes to continue expansion of his occupation.

loans.use: purchase a Rapid car

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna G. is from the town of Banga. She is 26 years old. Erna is married and has two young children aged three and two. To make a living, Erna owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business is planting and harvesting rice for sale. Erna works hard to be able to save for her children's education in the future.

Erna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erna has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Erna is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farming supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson K. K. is 30 years old, married, and has one child aged eleven years old and one who is six years old. His business is located at Jomvu estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attractions, not forgetting the Indian ocean's white beaches. He has been rearing and selling chickens to the local people and hotels. He has been in this business for the last four years. He says that this business is profitable, and the major challenge he has is lack of enough capital and the risk of diseases that could kill all the chicks. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 70,000 to buy more chicks to expand his business. He hopes to grow this business and even diversify into the cosmetics business. He sees himself owning a car some day. He describes himself as hardworking, God-fearing, and welcoming.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to raise.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena F. is from the town of Banga. She is 50 years old. Elena is married and has six children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business is planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elena wishes to have a better income for her family; that's why she works hard to achieve it.

Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elena is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farming supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Irene has rental houses, which she constructed six years ago. Her potential customers are neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of delayed payment from tenants. She hopes to build more rental houses in the future.

With her Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase iron sheets and timber to renovate her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets and timber to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (relatives).    Fatuma has a business of selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for six years, and she works six days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Fatuma has requested for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of cloth. The main business challenge for Fatuma is seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing these clothes herself. Fatuma lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Ond of her major monthly expenses is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma V. is from the town of Banga. She is 39 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Vilma owns & operates an agricutural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. One of Vilma's dreams in life is to have all her children finish college and for them to have bright futures. 

Vilma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. has successfully repaid her first Kiva loan. With the loan she financed the increasing customer demand on her fishing and resale of frozen foods businesses. She is so thankful for your support and for the opportunity to borrow money from Kiva. She wishes to access a larger loan to expand her businesses so that she can increase her turnover. Norma thanks KIVA for providing her with opportunity to increase her proceeds. Your support is very important to her family and they pray that all supporters be blessed because of their good hearts for the poor people around the world.

She is requesting a much larger loan of 25,000.00 Php to support her businesses. Norma has noted that her monthly income has almost doubled since she has attracted new customers with additional inventory.

With the support of ASHI and Kiva partner, she is hopeful that her business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life. Norma still dreams of supporting her children in their schooling until they finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: to maintain her fishing business and resale of frozen foods business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius T. S. is thirty eight years old, married and has no children yet. His business is located at a busy residential area in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites including the Indian Ocean white beaches. 

He has been rearing and selling chickens for the local people and hotels for the past four years. He says that this business is profitable and that the major challenges he faces are lack of enough capital and the risk that disease could kill all his chicks. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more chicks to expand his business. He hopes to grow this business and to provide a comfortable life for his family. He describes himself as hardworking and customer friendly.

loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 55-year-old married man and father of 2 children, one of whom is still attending the school. He has been running a clothing store for the past fifteen years. He sells only woman clothes. He has a good number of clients passing by his shop because he always presents new collections to attract them. With a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will expand his store’s inventory for the coming winter season. He says the loan will help him to diversify his merchandise selection. In the future, he is hoping to also sell woman shoes and bags by adding a corner for this purpose in this store.

loans.use: to expand his store’s inventory

loans.name: Pamella

texts.en:
Pamella N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). Pamella has a retail shop. She has been in this business for 2 years and works 6 days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000/ Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through commercial farming and charcoal selling. The main business challenges for Pamella include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand to a big supermarket. 

Pamella lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 25 years old and single. Marie lives with her parents and she has to contribute to her family by providing all necessities for the family. Marie owns a business selling clothes and she is a tailor sometime. Marie employs three people as helpers from her community and the hours of her business are from 7 AM to 6 PM.	

Marie is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more clothes and others clothing items for sale. With this loan, Marie needs to earn much money to use in her business. With the extra money, Marie will be able to save, which will allow her to get married in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and another items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a freezer for storing natural juice for resale.

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito R. is from the town of Banga. He is 61 years old, married and has 7 children. His eldest child is 36 years old and the younger ones still go to school. Anecito owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He works hard to help provide for his family. He also supports his children who still go to school.

Anecito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Anecito is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the Kanyanya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. Rose has a charcoal selling business. She has been in this business for 5 years and works 7 days a week. Rose sells her products retail from home. 

She has requested a loan of 600,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through rentals. The main business challenge(s) for Rose include transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand so that she can own a delivery van. 

Rose lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos de 25 años, el es conductor de una tricimoto (medio de transporte rápido y eficaz para ir a lugares que un carro no puede) vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral y rodeada por un estero. 

Empezó hace 5 años haciendo carreras con una tricimoto (medio de transporte rápido), debido a la necesidad y a que las personas de su sector necesitaban un medio de transporte rápido que llegara a los lugares que un transporte común no llega. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ha venido trabajando para poder mantener a su hija de 5 años. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere renovar la moto comprando una nueva para trabajar con mas rapidez, en el futuro quiere tener una casa ya que ahora vive en la casa de su tio y necesita darle una mejor vida a su hija.
texts.en:
25-year-old Carlos drives a motor rickshaw (a fast and efficient means of transport for going places where a car cannot). He lives in a peri-urban zone called “Perimetral” that is surrounded by a marsh.

He started 5 years ago making runs with a motor rickshaw (a speedy mode of transport), due to the necessity and because people in his area needed a fast means of transport that would get to the places that public transport would not. Since then, he has been working to support his 5-year-old daughter. He works from 8am to 9pm every day.

With the loan, he wants to change the motorcycle, buying a new one in order to work faster. In the future he wants to have a house, since he now lives in his uncle’s house and he needs to give his daughter a better life.

loans.use: Motorcycle

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated her business of selling Khanga’s (African traditional cloth) for over five years. She sells door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. Mesalim faces the major challenge of high transport costs as she has to move from door-to-door selling Khanga’s. She hopes to establish a Khanga shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase Khanga’s and also purchase construction materials for her shop. She decided to join Yehu because it is near her homestead and hence is accessible.

loans.use: To purchase Khanga's and construction materials for her shop.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily D. is from the town of Surallah. She is 46 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Emily owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in farming for over 20 years. She is hoping for an increase in her next harvest.

Emily joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for over two years, neighbours and passersby being her potential customers. Fridah faces a challenge of high transport cost incurred when transporting charcoal from rural areas to her place of operation. She hopes to own a dry cleaning machine and a photocopier machine in the future.

Fridah decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures. With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia J. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Eufemia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eufemia operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Eufemia was also able to put up a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of different products. She says the store provides daily income for the family.

Eufemia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eufemia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Eufemia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily E. is from the town of Banga. She is 39 years old. Emily is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Emily dreams to be a successful businesswoman someday.

Emily joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Emily is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees and make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose Freddy

texts.es:
José de 32 años, el es conductor de una tricimoto (medio de transporte rápido y eficaz para ir a lugares que un carro no puede) vive con su esposa e hijo de 4 años en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral y rodeada por un estero. 

Antes de comenzar como chofer de una tricimoto el se dedicaba a vender articulos para el hogar varios, pero como necesitaba un ingreso mas sostenible tumo la decisión de reunió dinero y comprar una moto para convertirla en tricimoto. Ya tiene 1 años trabajando desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Uno de los problemas que tiene es la constancia delincuencia que hay en el sector donde vive. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una moto para tener mas ingresos y así prestar mas servicios a la gente del sector donde vive. En el futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento y tener otras motos para asegurar la economía de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and drives a 'tricimoto' (a motorbike with a cart in back for passengers). This is a quick and efficient mode of transport for going places that a car cannot.  He lives with his wife and 4 year-old son in a peri-urban area called Perimetral which is surrounded by a salt marsh.

Before becoming a tricimoto driver, he used to sell various household products but as he needed a more sustainable income he decided to raise money and buy a motorbike to convert into a tricimoto.  He has been working for one year from 8.00am to 9.00pm every day.  One of the problems he has is the constant crime which exists in the area in which he lives.

With his loan, he would like to buy a motorbike in order to generate more income and so provide more services to the people in his area.  In the future, he would like to build a cement house and have other motorbikes in order to secure his family's finances.

loans.use: Motorbike

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has five children, one of whom is in school.  Aisha runs her business from a food stall. She has been in this business for over fifteen years and she works seven days a week. She sells her products for retail prices at the market.    

Aisha has requested a loan of 450,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of tomatoes, bags of cassava and both sweet and Irish potatoes.  The main business challenges for Aisha include seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going directly to farmers.   Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

She has operated her charcoal selling business for over five years, neighbors and passersby being her potential customers. She faces the challenges of high transport cost and government forest conservation policies. She hopes to own a matatu (fourteen passenger van) in the future.

Mary decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures and minimal collateral. With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita A. is from the town of Banga. She is 61 years old. Nelita is married and has two adult-aged children. She is engaged in rice farming. At her age, she is still strong enough to perform farming duties. She says she loves working at the farm as she has spent most of her life there. Nelita still wants to help provide for her family. She also wants to help send her grandchildren to school. Nelita hopes for her harvest to increase.

Nelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Nelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en:
Drocella was born in 1963 and is married without any children. Drocella takes care of two dependent relatives. She is a businesswoman but her husband does not work. That's why,she has to work hard to get everything her family needs. Drocella owns a business selling various styles of clothes. This business is known and organized. This is her fifth year of success in this business operation.

Drocella is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business by purchasing more bales of clothing for sale. With this expansion, Drocella will be more efficient and more effective.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of clothing for sale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane P. is from the town of Banga. She is 40 years old. Jane is married and has a 21-year-old child. She raises pigs and farms for a living. The pigs she grows are for fattening and sale. She also helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops. Jane also started a sari-sari store to help provide their daily needs. She hopes for all her ventures to succeed.

Jane joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Jane is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds, farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley S. is from the town of Banga. She is 41 years old. Shirley is married and has two children, aged 13 and 18. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice to sell. Shirley also allotted part of her land for growing vegetables. She plants bitter gourd and other kinds of vegetables. She also sells her harvest to the market.
