Shirley joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Shirley is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres Virtuosas del barrio San Miguel de la ciudad  se formó gracias a la invitación de formar un comité que recibieron por parte de una de las integrantes del comité Mujeres Unidas de Isla Bogado. 
Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el noveno ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, y está conformado por 18 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades. 
Así como la señora Clotilde D. quien invirtió el crédito en la compra de ropas para la temporada como de remeras, shorts, blusas y otros. 
Comenta que la venta de ropas le deja una buena ganancia y desea seguir con la actividad ya que la misma le permite dedicarse a su familia también, ya que ella abre solo en algunos horarios.
texts.en:
The committee of Virtuous Women from the San Miguel neighborhood formed following an invitation to create a committee by a member of United Women of Bogado Island.  

The Committee is in its ninth loan cycle with the Program Committee of Entrepreneurial Women with the Paraguaya Foundation.  It is made up of 18 members, all of whom work in different fields.

One of the members is Clotilde D., who used her loan to purchase seasonal clothing like shirts, shorts, and blouses.  She says she makes good profits selling clothes.  She wants to continue selling clothes since the job allows her to devote time to her family since she is only open certain hours of the day.

loans.use: Buying shirts, dresses, shorts, and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Merashid

texts.en:
Merashid is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the children. 

She has operated her business of selling natural juices from home for over four years. Neighbours and passersby are her potential customers. Merashid faces a major challenge of seasonality. Duringthe  rainy season the demand for juice is low compared to hot summer season where demands is high. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase a freezer. Merashid decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures and minimal collateral.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Veronica Alexandra

texts.es:
Verónica de 25 años, tiene una tienda mixta panadería/víveres. Vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Inicio obteniendo dinero como comerciante de Cd, poco a poco le comenzó a gustar el ser comerciante así que decidió que con sus ahorros tendría una panadería, pero con la ayuda de su mama pudo comprar víveres y convertir una su panadería en una tienda mixta de venta de víveres y panadería, desde hace tres años viene trabajando desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h30 todos los días. Vende cada pan a $ 0.10c/u, y los víveres como la libra de arroz a $ 0.35c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, lácteos, enlatados, arroz para su tienda mixta. En el futuro agrandar el local y surtir mas la parte de la panadería.
texts.en:
Veronica, 25, has a bakery / general store. She lives in the suburb of Guayaquil (an urban area in which most of inhabitants are street vendors).

She started earning money as a CD (compact disc) trader, little by little she began to like being salesperson and decided that with her savings she would have a bakery. With the help of her mother, she was able to buy food as well and covert the bakery into a general store combination.  For the last 3 years she has worked from 7:00 am until 9:30 pm everyday.  She sells bread at $0.10 each and food provisions such as rice at $0.35 per pound.

With the loan she wants to buy flour, milk, canned goods and rice for her general store. In the future, she would like to enlarge the store and expand the bakery.

loans.use: Flour, canned goods and rice

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora H. had always dreamed of seeing her four children graduate with degrees. This is because educational attainment is one of the major factors for gaining employment. The couple believes that education is wealth that others can’t steal. For this reason, they are working hard to give the best education for their 4 children. 

Rhodora wants to find a way to improve her family's quality of living. To this end, she joined Kiva partner, ASHI, and felt very happy to be given the chance to access working capital. The first few loans she received enabled her to operate her bamboo furniture making business. The profit from this business has been the main source of family income. Now that she and her husband Mamerto, have secured access to capital, her profits have improved. For that reason, she is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for a much larger amount. Specifically the loan fund will be used for buying raw materials needed for her business.  This will enable her to grow their business further so that they will have savings in the future. Her long term dreams are to continue supporting her children as well as building a stronger home that can withstand flooding common in her province. 

A dedicated member of ASHI since 2007, Rhodora has been a model member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and timely repayments on loans. Since joining ASHI, she has gained more self-confidence as a businesswoman and entrepreneur managing her own venture.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for her bamboo furniture making business.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a single woman with three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated her business of selling clothes and coconuts for over six years, selling from door to door. Munira faces a challenge of transportation as she moves from one place to another.  She hopes to operate a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan she wants to purchase second hand clothes and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good relations with it's clients.

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothes and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Sade

texts.en:
Sade is a married woman with two children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated her mat weaving business for over five years and sells to her neighbours from home. Sade faces a challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to be self reliant in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 loan she wants to purchase weaving materials for weaving mats for sale. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for weaving mats for sale.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
A dedicated member of ASHI since 2007, Chanda has been a model member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and timely repayments on loans. Since joining ASHI, she has gained more self-confidence as a entrepreneur managing her own endeavor.

Chanda wants to request a much larger loan to support the needs of her fishing business and at the same time to continue its operation. With Chanda’s passion for giving her family a brighter tomorrow, she will be eager to work hard and help her husband meet the needs of her family. 

Now, Chanda’s business has been very helpful in achieving her family dreams. Her greatest hope is that her family will be able to have a decent way of life. Her long term goals are to help support her children’s education until college is completed, invest and build a better house for the family, to move above the poverty line.

loans.use: To support the needs of her fishing business and it's continued operation.

loans.name: Segundo Vicente

texts.es:
Segundo de 59 años, tiene un local de repuestos de bicicletas y venta de encebollado. Vive con su esposa en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales).

Empezó aproximadamente hace 15 años atrás arreglando bicicletas, pero con el pasar del tiempo se dio cuenta que la gente quería comprar mas los repuesto que enviarlas arreglar así que opto comprar con sus ahorros repuestos de bicicletas y venderlos en su local. Para obtener mas dinero el también vende por las mañana en el mismo local de repuestos encebollados (plato típico como desayuno). Eso quiere decir que el negocio de encebollados lo tiene desde las 07h30 hasta las 09h30 y el resto de tiempo es para la venta de los repuestos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, pintura para hacer una adecuaciones para le local y tener espacio para las dos actividades que realiza. En el futuro quiere agrandar el local, y seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Segundo is 59 years old.  He owns a shop in which he sells spare bicycle parts and “encebollado” (a stew made with fish or meat and onions).  He lives with his wife in the suburb of Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the inhabitants are informal traders.  

He began repairing bicycles about 15 years ago, but as time passed, he realized that people wanted to buy the spare parts rather than send in the bicycles for repair so he decided to use his savings to buy spare parts and sell them in his shop. To earn more money, he also sells “encebollados” (a typical breakfast dish) at the same shop in the mornings.  That means he sells “encebollados” from 7:30 until 9:30 and he spends the remainder of his time selling spare parts.  

He will use this loan to buy cement and paint to make modifications to the shop and have space for both of his businesses.  In the future, he wishes to enlarge the shop, and continue working to help his family financially.

loans.use: Cement, paint.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aracely es una señora D. 44 años D. edad, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera y se dedica a la venta D. pescado y mariscos secos y frescos, este negocio lo tiene ubicado en la avenida D. comercio en San Francisco Gotera, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos  Mario Francisco D. 22 años, Douglas Armando D. 17 y Carlos Daniel D. 14 años D. edad.
Este negocio lo inicio por su hermana aunque hoy trabaja sola con su familia, el proceso D. la obtención del pescado inicia desD. la madrugada cuando compra el pescado en San Miguel, y a las 8:00am ya esta lista la venta en Gotera para iniciar a comercializarla, ya tiene más D. 20 años D. estar en esta actividad por lo que por muchos años este ha sido su única fuente D. ingreso para crecer y educar a sus hijos.
En esta ocasión ella solicita un préstamo para impulsar aun más su comercio D. mariscos y al mismo tiempo como se acerca la fecha D. los difuntos y muchas personas compran coronas D. flores, quiere aprovechar para hacer flores y vender en esta temporada, invirtiendo el préstamo en un 50 y 50 por ciento. Esta inversión ayudara a que pueda generara mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, su único riesgo con los mariscos es que tiene que venderlos rápido porque se daña cuando ya tiene varios días.
Su objetivo es obtener ganancias del negocio para educar a sus hijos y puedan ser unos profesionales, también cancelar oportunamente este préstamo y seguir trabajando para algún día contar con los fondos para construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Aracely is a 44 year old woman who lives in San Francisco Gotera. She sells fish and seafood, both fresh and dried. She has her stand on a street named Avenida D. Comercio in San Francisco Gotera. She is married and she lives together with her husband and their three children: Mario Francisco, 22 years old; Douglas Armando, 17 years old; and, Carlos Daniel, 14 years old. 

She started out with her sister as a business partner but now she works only with her family.  She purchases the fresh fish in the very early morning hours in San Miguel and by 8am she is ready to start selling in Gotera. She has more than 20 years' experience in the business and it has been her only source of income used to support and educate her children. 

She requests a loan to revitalize her seafood business and now especially that the day of the dead approaches and many people buy flowers, she wants to take advantage of the season and sell in this time. She plans to invest 50% of the funds on each one of her two businesses. This investment will help her generate more earnings to be used to supplement the family economy. The only risk has to sell the fresh seafood quickly to avoid losing freshness over several days. 

Her goal is to garner enough profit to send her kids to school, to help them have a career. She will also use her profits to repay this loan, and to save money enough to build her own home one day.

loans.use: To purchase seafood and flowers.

loans.name: Nlibakari

texts.en:
Nlibaka, a married woman with one child who is still too young for school, owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Nilbaka has operated her fresh water selling business for over four years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Nlibaka faces a challenge of seasonality in her business; during the hot summer season, water dams dry up and there is less water to supply, and during the winter rainy season, water is overly abundant.

Now hoping to establish a boutique and tailoring shop, Nilbaka has joined Yehu and is requesting a loan of Kshs 10,000 to purchase a sewing machine to start the tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to start a tailoring business.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family. 

She has operated her greengrocery business for two years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Tima faces a major challenge due to high transport cost in her business. She hopes to be self-reliant in her business.  

With the 20,000 KES she wants to stock vegetables for her stall. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To stock vegetables for her vegetable stall

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is old but strong, a mother who aims to become successful someday by developing her kaing- (small basket) making business and selling charcoal in the local community. Anselma is thankful to ASHI, for through the loan they have provided since 2008, Anselma has been able to maintain her two businesses by purchasing necessities, and she hopes to further improve her businesses in the future through hard work and the continuous assistance of ASHI and Kiva.

Lack of business capital encouraged her to ask for financial support from Kiva lenders. She will be glad should her loan request be granted, and she will utilize the loan wisely by purchasing the needed supplies for her ventures. Her hard work and perseverance are the groundwork for improving her life. Her long-term goal is to have her own booth for her products someday. Anselma hopes to maintain a long-term, sustainable kaing-making business.

loans.use: will support the maintenance of her businesses.

loans.name: Deginalda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIWASI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra.Deginalda; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía, ella cose  mantas, chompas y chalinas de diferentes colores y luego los envía al extranjero, la socia quiere tener un atienda para vender la artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lanas y mantas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs Deginalda belongs to the “QORIWASI” community bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of the same name.

She is a 39 year-old single mother with 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her craft business.  She sews blankets, sweaters and scarves in different colors which she then sends abroad.  She would like to have a store where she can sell her handicrafts and is requesting a loan so that she can buy materials such as wool and blankets.

She thanks everyone who will help make her dream possible by funding her loan and pledges to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase material such as wool and blankets

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 55 years old. Felicitas is widowed and has six adult children. Before, she only earned income through pig raising. Now she also farms for a living. She plants and harvests rice crops to sell to her community. She says investing in farming is a good decision since it has been helping her family financially. She hopes to keep her farm productive.

Felicitas joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicitas has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies and pay for the laborers who helped at her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and pay for the laborers who helped at her farm

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Communal Bank "Miraflores," located in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of Ilave and the department of Puno. She is 26 years old, single and has no children. She completed secondary education. 

Ana is a new member of the bank and just began working with Manuela Ramos a few days ago. She is asking for a loan of 500 Peru Nuevos Soles, which will allow her to increase the merchandise in her business of selling retail groceries, such as a variety of sodas. Her dream is to have a restaurant/bar. Learning about how the Communal Bank works has had a profound impact on Ana.

loans.use: Increase the merchandise of her grocery and soda store

loans.name: Cleopatra

texts.es: Cleopatra tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 1 año posee una librería, negocio que tiene instalado en su mismo domicilio. Desde entonces atiende todos los días, además procura que éste bien implementado su negocio con variedades de productos y artículos de oficina y escolar. Par ella este actividad le ha resultado muy rentable, puesto que la zona donde vive no hay un negocio de este rubro. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes atienden a la clientela que son varios los que acuden en el establecimiento. En todo este tiempo ha visto como su negocio se ha establecido y eso la anima a seguir trabajando y plantearse nuevos proyectos, como el de ampliar más el espacio de su librería e implementarlo de más productos. Este es su crédito número 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, afirma además que le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece  a todas las personas que son gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en útiles de escritorio como papeles metálicos y otra calidad de papel.
texts.en: Cleopatra is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in their own house. For a year, she has owned a book store, which is located in her home. She works there every day and it is stocked with a variety of school and office supplies. This has been very profitable for her, since it is located in an area where there are not other businesses of this type. At times, her children help her; they work with the various customers who come to the store. During all this time, she has seen how her business has become established. This encourages her to continue working and to plan new projects, like increasing the size of her store and adding more products. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very pleased to know she has financial support. She also states that she is grateful to be a part of her community bank because all of the members are very supportive and responsible. She is also grateful for those who help to provide this loan; it will be very useful in her business’ progress. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of more desk items and accessories like foil paper and other types of paper.

loans.use: to buy more products like foil paper and other types of paper

loans.name: Ana Rocio

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Communal Bank Active Women II, located in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román, and department of Puno. She is 23 years old, single, and has no children. She has studied to a complete degree of higher education.

Ana has worked with Manuela Ramos for six months and her first loan was for 500 Peruvian nuevos soles (PEN), which she used to increase the capital of her business selling hardware. 

She is requesting a new loan of 800 PEN, which will be used to purchase contruction materials for her hardware store. 

Her dream for the future is to have more capital for her business and to open a store in Puno. 

Her favorite part about the Communal Bank is the terms of repayment.

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a member of the Communal Bank "Great Power", located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, and in the department of Puno. She is 30 years old, and in a common law marriage with one child. She has a secondary school education.

Elisa has worked with Manuela Ramos for five years. Her first loan was for the amount of 300 PEN, and was used to buy produce for her business selling grains, which she gets from Arequipa. She also has a second business that she shares with her husband, in which she sells spare parts. 

Currently, she is asking for a loan of 2,500 PEN, money that will be used to increase the capital of her business selling spare parts. 

Her dream for the future is to have a well-stocked grocery store.

Her favorite thing about working with the Communal Bank is that it allows her to have savings.

loans.use: Increase the capital for her business selling spare parts

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida is a member of the Communal Bank Grand Power, located in the district of Ilave, in the province of Ilave, and the department of Puno. She is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She has an incomplete primary school education.

Armida has been working with Manuela Ramos for six years. The first loan she got was for 300 PEN and she used it to buy flour to bake bread. 

She now needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will use for her business. 

Her dream is to expand her business of making one kind of bread, to make all types of bread; she would also like to have a grocery store. The thing she likes about working with the Communal Bank is that it facilitates participation and being able to express oneself without fear of anyone.

loans.use: Increase her business of selling breads.

loans.name: Virgen De La Candelaria Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Virgen de la Candelaria del barrio, se formó con integrantes del comité Virgen de las Mercedes del mismo barrio, las cuales quisieron formar un nuevo comité más cerca de sus casas,  actualmente el comité se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya.

La señora Graciela T. se dedica a la venta de productos de uso domésticos especialmente para el consumo de la familia, y la tiene la despensa que les provee a sus vecinos.
Esta muy satisfecha con su negocio ya que el mismo cubre todo los gasto de alimentación de la familia que es lo más importante para ella.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de fideos, arroz, azúcar, yerba mate, aceite y otros.
texts.en: The Virgen de la Candelaria ["Virgin of Candelaria"] Women's Group was formed by members of the Virgen de la Mercedes ["Virgin of Mercedes"] Group who lived in the same neighborhood and wanted to form a solidarity group closer to their homes. The group is currently in its fourth loan cycle with the "Enterprising Women" program of Fundación Paraguaya Ms. Graciela T. sells items that are typically used in the home, especially for feeding a family. She already has a small store set up, from which she sells to her neighbors. She is very satisfied with her business, as it covers all of the nutritional expenses for her family, which is the most important thing to her. She is requesting this loan to buy noodles, rice, sugar, yerba mate [a bitter herbal tea], oil, and other items.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, noodles, oil, and other staple food items

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando M. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 42 years old. Armando is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Armando owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Armando is planning on raising pigs to help with their family's income.

Armando joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armando has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Armando is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and 3 piglets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and 3 piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fabric, Kitchen items, Chairs

loans.name: Alima

texts.fr:
Madame ALIMA T. est âgé e de 49 ans, mariée et mère  de 2 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari  dans une grande famille traditionnelle au  quartier Pelengana Sud de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne pour des raisons sociales analphabétisme des parents, elle commença très tôt le commerce, auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, elle finit par évoluer seule pour mener  d’abord le commerce de tasses et maintenant celui des habits et chaussures. Elle mène cette activité depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et de faire face à la demande clientèle qui est de plus en plus grande, elle  a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est  à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 50 complets d’habits. Elle   s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle  envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales et de participer à des événements sociaux.  Son ambition est de pérenniser son activité et de construire une maison
texts.en:
49-year-old Alima T. is married and a mother of two. She lives with her husband in a large traditional family in the Pelengana Sud district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).
Not having gone to school for social reasons and her parents’ illiteracy, she got into business early alongside her mother who used to sell condiments. After several years of apprenticeship, she started off on her own selling cups. She now sells clothing and shoes. She has run this business for 20 years and has many customers and a good reputation.
Looking to boost her capital, in order to increase her profits and meet her ever-growing customer demand, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan, which she will use to buy 50 sets of clothing. She gets her stock in Burkina Faso and sells for cash and on credit to both women and men.
With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 XOF. This profit will allow her to help her husband provide for their family and to participate in social events. Her ambition is to make her business sustainable and to build a house.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina N. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, all of whom are in school.

Safina changed her business enterprise from a retail shop to selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for a few months and works 7 days out of every week. Safina sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail.

Safina has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Safina include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are expanding her business. Safina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr:
Madame   HAWA T. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère  de 2 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari  dans une grande famille traditionnelle au  quartier Missira de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt à faire le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des articles divers. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage et nanties de cette expérience, elle décide  d’évoluer seule en optant pour commerce de bois de construction. Elle mène cette activité depuis 9 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de son bois très prisés par les maçons.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec Soro  Yiriwaso depuis 54 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 chargements de bois. Elle   s’approvisionne sur place auprès des paysans producteurs. Madame HAWA T. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle  envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales et de participer à des événements sociaux.  Ses ambitions sont de renforcer son commerce et  construire  une maison.
texts.en:
45-year-old Hawa T. is married and a mother of two. She lives with her husband in a large traditional family in the Missira district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).
Not having gone to school for social reasons, she got into business early, working alongside her mother who sold various items. Equipped with the experience of several years as an apprentice, she started off on her own selling timber. She has run this business for 9 years, and has many customers and a good a reputation. Her business’s strength lies in the quality of her timber, which is well sought-after by builders.
Looking to increase her capital, in order to increase her profits, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 54 months. After receiving and repaying three solidarity loans and three individual loans, she is on her fourth individual loan, which she plans to use to buy 2 loads of timber. She sources her stock from local producers. Hawa sells for cash and on credit to mostly male customers.
With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 100,000 XOF. This profit will allow her to help her husband provide for their family and to participate in social events. Her goals are to expand her business and to build a house.

loans.use: Purchase of timber

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 58 años, es viuda y vive a lado de sus 2 hijas que son mayores y tienen su propia familia. Desde hace 18 años se dedica a la venta de leche, producto que extrae de su misma vaca que cría. Es así que todos los días se dirige al estable de un familiar, lugar donde cuida a su vaca, desde muy temprano realiza el ordeño en donde extrae la leche fresca, para luego ser vendido a clientes que son comerciantes de productos lácteos. Además de vender leche, procesa este producto para convertirla en yogurt natural y queso. De la misma manera vende mazamorras de manera ambulante, eso le genera ingresos diarios a su hogar. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, ya tiene varios años de experiencia y ahora su gran anhelo es tener más vacas. Es su crédito número 13 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero. Asegura además que le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de envases, así como semillas ya que sembrará alfalfa, que servirá como forraje para su vaca.
texts.en: Adela is 58 years old.  She is a widow and lives with her two grown-up daughters who have their own families.  For 18 years she has been selling milk for a living.  The milk comes from her own cow which she reared.  Every day she heads to a family member's stable where she looks after her cow.  Very early in the morning she milks her cow and obtains fresh milk which is then sold to her customers who are dairy product salesmen.  In addition to selling milk, she processes it into yoghurt and cheese.  She also sells 'mazamorra' (a Peruvian dessert) in an itinerant manner which provides daily income for her home.  She enjoys her work a lot, she already has several years' experience and now her great desire is to have more cows.  This is her 13th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She states that she likes being part of her community bank because all its members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive.  She also thanks all those who will help fund the loan that she is requesting as it will be very useful for her business' progress.  She will use her loan to purchase containers as well as seed because she will sow alfalfa which will be given to her cow as fodder.

loans.use: To purchase containers to keep milk fresh and to purchase alfalfa which will be used as fodder for her cow

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is very happy that, with the loan from ASHI, a first Kiva field partner, she is able to provide satisfactory services to her regular customers by fulfilling their orders without delay. She wishes to access a larger loan to expand her handicraft business so she can earn more profits. 

Prior to ASHI, Merlinda had no access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams. She joined ASHI to follow her dreams of providing a decent life for her family. To fulfill this inspiration, she took out a loan and started her own handicraft business. As she continued to take loans from ASHI and save some of her profits, she was able to grow her business. Many souvenir shop owners visit Merlinda's village to purchase her products. Other customers are Overseas Filipino Workers (OFW) wanting to buy presents for their colleagues abroad. With the loan, Merlinda has noticed that her weekly income has almost doubled since she has attracted new customers with additional inventory.

Now she is proposing another loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to support maintenance of her business and purchase inventory of raw materials needed for her handicraft. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s standard of living and support the education of her 2 children until they are complete degree holders.

loans.use: To fund the needed materials for her business.

loans.name: Salim

texts.fr:
Monsieur SALIM M. est âgé e de 49 ans, marié et père   de 4 enfants.  Il  vit dans une famille nucléaire au  quartier Pelengana Sud de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Technique d’électricité de profession, parallèlement à cette activité, il tient une quincaillerie en face de l’hôtel Indépendant de Ségou. Il a appris ce commerce auprès de sa mère qui avait une quincaillerie. Les soirs et les jours où il n’y avait pas classe, il gérait ce petit commerce qui l’aidait à comprendre  les rouages du commerce de quincaillerie. Une fois dans la vie active et nostalgique de ce secteur, il ouvre une quincaillerie. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et de faire face à la demande clientèle qui est de plus en plus grande, il fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est  à son 1er   prêt individuel,  qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 cartons de clous et 10 cartons de peintures à Bamako. Monsieur SALIM M. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet de payer sa location et de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mr. SALIM M. is a 49-year-old married man with four children. He lives in a nuclear family in the Pelengana neighborhood, in southern Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali).

Mr. M. is an electrician by trade, and he also runs a hardware store across the street from the Independent hotel of Ségou. He learned the business from his mother who had a hardware store. He used to spend evenings and off-school days managing the small shop, which helped him understand the mechanics of the hardware business. Once in the workforce, he started to miss it and opened a hardware store of his own.

Hoping to bolster his working capital to boost his profits and meet the needs of a steadily increasing customer base, he turned to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution for his first individual loan, which he will use to buy two boxes of nails and ten cartons of paint in Bamako. 
He sells for cash or credit to a clientele consisting of women and men. 

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000FCFA. This will allow him to pay his rent and cover the family’s expenses.

loans.use: To purchase hardware store items

loans.name: Lorena Rosario

texts.es:
Lorena de 41 años, ella es comerciante de ropa y artículos varios, vive con sus cuatro hijos de 23, 19, 9, 4 años en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciales informales). 

Para poder mantener a su familia y ayudar a su esposo tuvo que comenzar a trabajar como con su cuñada pero como ella quería general sus propios ingresos decidio tener su propio local de ropa y artículos varios,  comenzó a vender la ropa en su local y a sus vecinos , Poco a poco a incrementado su negocio con las ventas de camisas, zapatos, pantalones etc. 

Para continuar con su negocio de venta de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo blusas y pantalones. En el futuro quiere tener otro negocio en la bahía ya que es el lugar mas comercial de Guayaquil.
texts.en:
Lorena is 41 years old . She’s a storekeeper who sells clothing and other various products. She lives with her 4 children; they are 23, 19, 9 and 5. They live in Guayaquil, in the "Guasmo" ( an urban area where the majority of the residents are informal merchants).

In order to maintain her family and help her husband, Lorena had to start working with her sister-in-law. However, since she wanted her own income, she decided to have her own place to sell clothing and other merchandise. She started by selling clothing near her home and to her neighbors. Little by little, she increased her business by selling shirts, shoes, pants, etc. as well.

To continue with her clothing business, she wants to buy blouses and pants with the loan. In the future, she wants to have another store in “la bahia”, the most commercial area of Guayaquil.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet K. lives in Naguru, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 8 children, five of whom are in school.  

Annet has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Annet sells her products from home, by means of retail. Annet has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal. She also generates additional income through frying cassava and chips and plaiting hair.

The main business challenge(s) for Annet include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going directly to villages for charcoal. Annet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson, es obrero en una empresa industrializadora de leche, tiene un hijo de 2 años y vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Villa Kiswaras de la ciudad de El Alto. Tiene un segundo trabajo en las noches en una panadería donde trabaja de panadero.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar materiales de construcción (cemento, ladrillo, arena y fierro) para construir un horno donde pueda elaborar pan y comercializar dicho producto en las tiendas de abarrotes de la ciudad de el Alto. Su historial con IMPRO indica que es cliente desde el año 2008.
Con la construcción del horno, podrá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la situación de su familia. 
 Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Wilson is a factory worker in the industrial milk factory. He has a 2-year-old son and lives with his parents in the Villa Kiswaras area in the city of El Alto. He has a second job at night in a bakery where he works as a baker. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy construction materials (cement, bricks, sand and iron) to build an oven where he can bake bread and sell it to the grocery stores in the city.

His credit history with IMPRO indicates that he has been a client since 2008. By building the oven he will be able to increase his income and improve his family's situation. This is his third loan with IMPRO and the first one through Kiva

loans.use: Build an oven to bake bread and start his own business

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants par femme. Elles habitent le quartier Médine  de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente des crèmes à peau, des habits de la friperie, des pagnes wax, bazins et brodés. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata T. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 ballons d’habits de la friperie composés de draps et de napperons. Elle se ravitaille en habits au grand marché de Bamako en gros et les revend en détail, au comptant, à crédit, à domicile, au marché Médine de Ségou et en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de la ville à une clientèle constituée généralement de femmes. 
Madame Fatoumata T. compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les petits besoins du foyer et réinvestir dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of married women living mainly in polygamous families, who average 33 years of age and three children. They live in Médine district of the city of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali), and now each other as neighbors and relatives by marriage. The group members retail body cream, used clothing and traditional colorful fabrics of “wax” and “basins” [similar to damask] types as well as embroidered. 

In order to increase their working capital, the group members have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are now on the first solidarity loan. Mrs. Fatoumata T. plans to use her loan to purchase two bales of used clothing and linens. She stocks up at the big marked in Bamako, buying wholesale and selling retail, for cash and on credit, out of her home, at the Médine market in Ségou as well as a street vendor in different districts of the city, to a customer base composed mainly of women.

Mrs. Fatoumata T. plans to achieve a monthly benefit of 25,000 West African Francs, which will be used to cover some everyday household needs, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing used clothing

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 45 years old. Delia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Delia is hoping to have a stable income to sustain her family's needs.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Delia is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, es comerciante de abarrotes tiene dos hijos, el esposo es transportista y  viven en casa propia ubicada en la Zona de Cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito que solicita será destinado a la compra de un equipo GNV (Gas natural vehicular) para la transformación de la movilidad de su esposo de Gasolina a Gas, para disminuir el costo de operaciones del vehiculo, pues el gas natural es más barato que la gasolina. De esta manera ellos podrán incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen sells groceries. She has two children. Her husband is a minibus driver. They live in their own house located in the Cotahuma area of the city of La Paz.

The loan she is applying for will be used for the purchase of GNV (vehicular natural gas) equipment for converting her husband’s minibus from running on gasoline to gas in order to reduce the cost of operating the vehicle, since natural gas is cheaper than gasoline. In this way they will be able to increase their income.

loans.use: The cost of converting her husband's public transport vehicle from running on gasoline to natural gas.

loans.name: Kafo Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Kafo sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et habitant le quartier Sokalakono de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le grand marché de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente des encensoirs, chaussures plastiques, condiments (boites de tomate concentrée, Sounbala, cubes jumbo et gombo frais) et des pagnes wax. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les marchandises à vendre, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Tata  K. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 150 paires de chaussures en plastiques pour hommes et femmes. Elle se ravitaille en marchandises au grand marché de Bamako en gros et les revend en détail, au comptant, à crédit, à domicile, au grand marché de Ségou et en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de la ville à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame Tata K. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les frais scolaires des enfants et les petits besoins du foyer. 
Elle a pour objectif de devenir grossiste dans la vente des chaussures au grand marché de Ségou.
texts.en:
The Kafo group consists of six married women living in monogamous families. They average 35 years of age and four children each, and live in the Sokalakono neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). 

They became acquainted as neighbors, through kinship and through their business activities in the big market of Ségou. 

The group members’ activities revolve around the purchase and sale of incense burners, plastic shoes, condiments (cans of tomato paste, Sounbala, Jumbo bouillon cubes, and fresh okra), and wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth).

In order to increase their working capital and diversify their merchandise, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are currently on their fourth group loan.

Mrs. Tata K. plans to use her loan to buy 150 pairs of plastic shoes for men and women. She gets her stocks wholesale at the big market of Bamako and resells the merchandise to a mixed clientele at retail, for cash or credit, from her home and at the great market of Ségou, and on the streets, in the various neighborhoods of the city.

With this loan, Mrs. K. hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 30 000FCFA, which she will use to pay for the children’s school fees and for small household expenses.

She hopes to become a wholesale merchant of plastic shoes at the big market of Ségou.

loans.use: To purchase plastic shoes

loans.name: Norome Group

texts.es:
El grupo Norome lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras originarias de Masaya, cuna del folklor nicaragüense, una de ellas es la señora Anastia Gaitán de 40 años quien vende cosméticos. Gaitán inicio con el comercio de frutas y verduras en el mercado Oriental y desde hace dos años invirtió en cosméticos y perfumes negocio en el que le ha ido muy bien. 
Ella es madre y padre de dos niños por los cuales labora arduamente todos los días para que no les falte un techo, el pan y los estudios principalmente. El crédito lo invertirá en perfumes  y algún día desea poder ella con su propio dinero costear su negocio.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Petrona del Carmen M. Paramo de 50 años desde 1990 se dedica al comercio de ropa usada actividad en la que invertirá el crédito y Zeneyda del Socorro de 21 años ella inicio comercializando frutas en la actualidad vende leña.
texts.en:
The Norome group is made up of three hard-working, diligent and enterprising women from Masaya, the birthplace of Nicaraguan folklore.  One of the women is Mrs Anastia Gaitán who is 40 years old and sells cosmetics.  Gaitán started out selling fruit and vegetables in the Mercado Oriental market and two years ago invested in cosmetics and perfumes, a business in which she has done very well.

She is mother and father to two children for whom she works hard every day to keep a roof over their heads, make sure that they have food and that they stay in school.  She will use her loan to buy perfumes and one day she hopes to be able to use her own money to finance her business.

Petrona del Carmen M. Paramo is another member of the group.  She is 50 years old.  Since 1990 she has worked selling second-hand clothes.  This is the activity for which she will use her loan.  The group's final member is Zeneyda del Socorro who is 21 years old.  She started off selling fruit and currently sells firewood.

loans.use: Cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esperanza está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Adela del Carmen N. de 59 años quien inicio hace 30 años con la venta de leña y carbón negocio que cambio hace siete años por tener una tortillería amplia. Ella es una madre execional la cual ha preparado a sus hijos para ser personas de bien y que cumplan sus sueños; su hijo menor de 20 años está estudiando Ingeniería Agrónoma. 
N. tiene dos trabajadoras con quienes produce una gran cantidad duel bastimento por excelencia de los nicaragüenses e invertirá el crédito en trigo, leña, maíz etc. para aumentar la producción 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Carmencita del Socorro Díaz Valles de 29 años quien tiene una tortillería desde hace 8 años y Damaris Karina C. de 24 años desde hace dos años aproximadamente vende truchas.
texts.en:
The Esperanza (Hope) group is made up of three hardworking women. One of them is Adela del Carmen N., age 59. Thirty years ago, she began selling firewood and charcoal, a business that changed seven years ago to a large tortilla making operation. She is an exceptional mother who has prepared her children to be honest people who achieve their dreams. Her youngest child, age 20, is studying agricultural engineering.

N. has two employees with whom she produces a large quantity of tortillas, the basis of the Nicaraguan diet. She will invest the loan in wheat, firewood, corn, etc. in order to increase production.

The other members of the group are Carmencita del Socorro Díaz Valles, age 29, who has had a tortilla making business for 8 years, and Damaris Karina C., age 24, who has been selling trout for about 2 years.

loans.use: Corn, firewood, lime powder, etc.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos, es transportista publico de trufi inter-ciudad La Paz – El Alto; tiene tres hijos y vive en la casa propia en la zona Ciudadela Ferroviaria de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de un motor y caja de transmisión para su vehiculo, pues necesita inmediatamente una reparación para seguir funcionando en optimas condiciones.

 Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y el primer vía Kiva. El estudio del flujo de caja le permite acceder a este primer crédito.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, is a public transportation driver on the La Paz-El Alto inter-city route.  He has three children and lives in his own house in the neighborhood of Ciudadela Ferroviaria in the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to buy an engine and transmission for his vehicle and to also repair it.  He needs repairs immediately in order to keep the vehicle running in top condition.

This is his first loan with IMPRO and also with Kiva.  The study of cash flow allows him to access this first loan.

loans.use: To purchase an engine and transmission for a public transport vehicle.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Amalia C. es cliente recurrente  de nuestra entidad, es casada y vive en casa propia en la ciudad de Luque.
 La titular cuenta con una despensa hace mas de 10 años, posee una buena clientela formada ya que es una de las despensas mas surtidas en el barrio, dicho préstamo solicito para comprar un lote de mercaderías. 
La Sra. Amalia opera desde el 2005 con Fundación Paraguaya., y solo con nuestra entidad opera en préstamo en esta ocasión ha retirado su sexto préstamo habiendo abonado las demás todas en fecha.
Dicho préstamo la titular considera que le dejara un mejor margen de ganancia a su negocio y a la vez le ayudara para un  mejor nivel de vida ya mediante el présrtamo podrá adquirir mercaderias como fideos, arroz, aceite, jugos y otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Amalia C. is a returning client of Fundación Paraguaya. She is married and lives in her own home in the city of Luque.

Amalia has managed a food pantry for more than ten years. She has a good customer base already established because she is one of the most well-stocked stores in the neighborhood. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a large quantity of merchandise.

Sra. Amalia has partnered with Fundación Paraguaya since 2005 and this is the only institution from which she has received loans. As of now, she is requesting her sixth loan and has repaid her previous ones on time. Amalia says the loan will help her increase the profit margin of her business and improve her standard of living. The loan will be used to acquire merchandise such as noodles, rice, oil, juices, and other products.

loans.use: Purchase noodles, rice, oil, juices, and other products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 41 years old. Myrna is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Myrna has been farming since she was in her twenties. She said it helped that her parents were also farmers because she learned early.

Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is thankful for the services she availed of. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Wassa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wassa est composé de femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants par femme. Elles habitent le quartier Médine Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (pâte d’arachide, piment, Sounbala, poudre de gombo et de l’ail), de la restauration et des pommades. 
D ans le but de pouvoir constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sitan  Traoré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 500kg de piments frais. Elle se ravitaille en piments frais avec les forains de Koutiala au grand marché de Ségou en gros. Ce piment est ensuite séché au soleil pendant une semaine au moins sur des bâches dans un coin de la cour pour la conservation. Elle le revend au comptant, à crédit, à domicile et au marché Médine de Ségou à une clientèle constituée généralement de femmes. 
Madame Sitan Traoré compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les petits besoins du foyer et réinvestir dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Wassa group is made up of married women, most of them from monogamous families, each with an average age of 34 and three children. They live in the Médine neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other through blood and neighborhood ties, as well as marriage.

The group members sell condiments (peanut butter, chili peppers, “Sounbala” (a popular West African condiment), gumbo powder and garlic powder), prepared foods, and ointments. In order to be able to build up their stock of goods, they decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Sitan Traoré plans to use her loan to buy 500 kilograms of fresh chili peppers. She buys her fresh chili peppers wholesale from the Koutiala stallholders at the big market in Ségou. These chili peppers are then dried in the sun for at least a week on tarps in a corner of the courtyard in order to preserve them. They resell them for cash and credit, door-to-door and at the Médine market in Ségou; their customers are generally women.

With this loan Mrs. Sitan Traoré plans to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA, which will be used to meet the secondary needs of the household and to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: Purchase of fresh chili peppers

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.   Annet has a business of selling chickens. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Annet sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Annet has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more chickens. The main business challenge(s) for Annet include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start rearing chickens herself.  Annet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mamdy

texts.fr:
Monsieur MAMDY O. est âgé e de 30 ans, marié et père   de 1 enfant.  il  vit  dans une famille nucléaire au  quartier Pelengana Sud de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Ayant abandonné l’école à bas âge pour mener des activités génératrices de revenus dans le souci de subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il  commença très tôt à faire le commerce auprès d’une connaissance qui faisait de la fabrication du savon local. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, il finit par évoluer seul pour mener la même activité depuis maintenant  4 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. 
Pour faire du savon il a besoin de la soude caustique, de la pâte noire, de l’huile et d’eau.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et de faire face à la demande clientèle qui est de plus en plus grande, il  a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Il   est  en relation avec cette dernière depuis 24 mois, après 2 prêts individuels correctement remboursés, il est à son 3ème  prêt individuel   qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 10 sacs de soude caustiques et 20 fûts de pâtes noires. Il   s’approvisionne sur place. 
Monsieur MAMDY O.  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, il   envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet de renouveler son stock et de payer sa location.
texts.en:
Mr Mamdy O. is 30 years old, married and father of one child. He lives with his wife and child in the Pengana Sud quarter of Segou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali)
He left school at an early age to carry out income generating activities so he could provide for his family. He started in business very early working for an acquaintance who made soap. After several years of training, he started his own business which he has run now for 4 years. He has a large clientele and is well known.
To make soap, he needs caustic soda, black paste, oil and water.
With the intention of expanding his business, in order to increase his profits and meet client demand which continues to grow, he turned to Soro Yiriwaso. He has been collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso for  24 months, and after 2 individual loans which were duly repaid, he is now looking to take out a 3rd loan which he intends to use to buy 10 bags of caustic soda and 20 barrells of black paste. He sources his supplies locally.
Mr Mamdy Ouedgrago accepts cash and credit and has a clientele made up of both men and women.
With this loan he hopes to make a monthly profit of 100 000FCFA. This profit will allow him to renew his stocks and pay his rent.

.

loans.use: Achat de matières premières pour faire du savon

loans.name: Klever Alfonso

texts.es:
Klever de 30 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales) el tiene un taller de cerrajería (lugar donde se crean y reparan puertas, ventanas etc.) 

Casi toda su familia se dedica a esta actividad por eso el quiso continuar con esta cadena familiar debido a que le enseñaron desde pequeño ha hacer puertas, ventanas, artículos de metal. Tiene su taller de cerrajería en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h30pm. Las puertas metálicas las vende a $ 140.00 asi mismo con las ventanas y planchas según su tamaño. 

Para poder continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas, tubos, planchas. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y tener el taller de cerrajería en un local.
texts.en:
Klever is 30 years old and lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants. He manages a metal shop where he manufactures and repairs doors, windows, and other items.

Since almost all of his family is involved in this type of business, Klever decided to follow in his family’s footsteps and continue in the same line of work. As a young boy, he learned how to make doors, windows, and other items made of metal. He set up a metal shop in the front part of his house where he works from 7am until 6:30pm. He sells the metal doors for $140.00 and windows and security bars according to size.

In order to continue with his business, Klever wants to use this loan to buy equipment, tubing, and metal plates. In the future, he hopes to make improvements to his house and establish his metal shop in a formal location.

loans.use: Purchase equipment, tubing, and metal plates

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah N. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (one relative).

Dorah has a business of selling second hand men's clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Dorah sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Dorah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more clothes. She also generates additional income through poultry farming.

The main business challenge(s) for Dorah include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start rearing Frisian cows. Dorah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of men's shirts and t-shirts.

loans.name: Como Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Como las Águilas está conformado por cinco mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Flora de María de 50 años la cual desde hace años ha trabajado de todo un poco actualmente se dedica a la realización de nacatamales y la venta de leña negocios en los que invertirá el crédito. Ella es madre y padre para sus hijos de los cuales tiene dos menores de 14 y 11 años quienes estudian.

Las otras integrantes de grupo son Yadira, Claudia María, Mercedes y María Cecilia. Sabala se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace 2 años y sueña con tener un establecimiento ya que trabaja de manera ambulante;  Gómez tiene un taller donde se especializa en la realización cuadros y su meta es aumentarle al taller,  P. de 50 años se dedica al destace de cerdo y riega ropa en zona franca las mercedes desde hace 8 años, y O. de 32 años vende delantales y  hueso y enchiladas las fines de semana desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
The group “Como Las Águilas” (Like The Eagles) consists of five hardworking women.  One of them is Flora de María, age 50, who has worked for many years in all different areas.  She currently makes Nicaraguan tamales and sells firewood.  Flora wants to invest the loan in her businesses.  She assumes the roles of both mother and father to her two young children, ages 14 and 11, who are in school.

The members of the group are Yadir, Claudia María, Mercedes, and María Cecilia.  Yadira has been selling clothing and cosmetics for two years and dreams of opening her own establishment since she works as a street vendor.  Claudia has a shop that specializes in making paintings.  Her goal is to expand her business.  Mercedes, age 50, has been butchering pigs and selling clothing in the free trade zone for eight years.  María, age 32, has been selling aprons, seeds, and enchiladas on the weekends for the past four years.

loans.use: Purchase pork, corn, onions, peppers, tomatoes, cumin, and other ingredients

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia tiene 33 años está casada con el Sr. Ubaldo de 38 años, tienen 3 hijos una mujer y dos varones de16, 15 y 14 años todos ellos estudiando en el colegio.
Desde su infancia se dedico a la peluquería ya que sus padres siempre  tuvieron salones de belleza, con el tiempo y con mucho esfuerzo estudio peluquería y pudo independizarse de sus padres, actualmente cuenta con 2 salones de belleza con una clientela  formada.
Le gustaría para más adelante que sus hijos culmines sus estudios y que sigan una carrera universitaria.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos, productos de belleza, shampoo, enjuages
texts.en:
Sra. Patricia is 33 years old and married to Sr. Ubaldo, age 38. They have three children, a 16 year old daughter and two sons who are 15 and 14 years old. All of them are high school students.

Since childhood, Patricia wanted to be a hairdresser and her parents always owned beauty salons. As time passed and with great effort, she was able to study cosmetology and become independent from her parents. Patricia currently owns two beauty salons and has an established customer base.

She wants to get ahead so that her children can finish their studies and pursue a university degree. Patricia is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics, beauty products, shampoos, and hair rinses.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, beauty products, shampoos, and hair rinses

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Mariatu. She is married and has 1 child, aged 3 months. In 1995, Mariatu established her business of selling plastic bowls, sets of pans, and food items. She began this business to generate more income to help her husband provide livelihood for their family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more inventory.

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Mariatu plans to buy piece of land. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy assorted rubbers bowls, sets of pans, dishes, and palm oil.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda R. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 57 years old. Luzviminda is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Luzviminda also manages a small piggery for raising pigs for fattening.

Luzviminda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and feed.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus N. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her maid).

Dorcus has a business of making samosas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 1 day out of every week. Dorcus sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Dorcus has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of cow peas and wheat flour. She also generates additional income through poultry farming.

The main business challenge(s) for Dorcus include thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are expanding her business of poultry farming. Dorcus lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cow peas and wheat flour.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar tiene 50 años está casado con la Sra. Delia Jiménez tienen 3 hijos, 1 está casado y los otros 2 estudian medicina y derecho.
El señor trabajaba en un taller de joyería aprendiendo todo sobre trabajos por varios años ganando experiencia y un día decidió independizarse; abrió para su propio taller de joyería, dando trabajo a sus hijos en aquel momento.
 Actualmente se dedica a la venta de joyas independientemente de poseer también una ferretería en su domicilio que administra su señor y solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderias para los dos negocios que posee.
En el futuro le gustaría montar un deposito de materiales de construcción por la zona donde se encuentra su domicilio y porque hay una gran demanda.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar is 50 years old and married to Sra. Delia Jiménez. They have three children, one of whom is married while the other two are studying medicine and law.

Sr. Oscar worked at a jewelry store where he learned every aspect of the business. He spent several years gaining experience until one day he decided to open his own jewelry shop. At the time, he was able to provide jobs for his children.

Oscar currently sells jewelry as an independent merchant, but he also he also manages a hardware store out of his home. He is requesting a loan so that he can purchase merchandise for both businesses.

In the future, he would like to build up an inventory of construction materials in his home to sell in the area because there is great demand for these products.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his hardware store & his jewelry shop

loans.name: Cielo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cielo está conformado por cuatro féminas trabajadoras una de ella es Benicia M. Ruiz  de 56 años propietaria de una pulpería la cual inicio en1992 con el comercio de granos básicos esto lo hizo para poder cuidar a su hija mayor la cual es una niña con capacidades diferentes. En la actualidad ella invertirá en ropa interior, camisas, blusas, pantalones etc. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Carla Vanessa M. Gómez, Katia Lucia R. Pérez y Magali Margarita M. Rivas. La joven M. de 26 años inicio con la venta de cosméticos y la realización de trabajos de belleza a domicilio (manicure, pedicura, alisado, tintes...etc.). En el 2009 instalo en su casa su pequeño salón de belleza hoy en día cuenta con un local propio el cual desea invertir para condicionarlo. Mientras R. de 31 años vende ropa interior y cosméticos actividad económica que ha ido creciendo y M.  de 25 años se dedica a la realización de pequeñas piezas de ropa.
texts.en:
The group “Cielo” (Sky) consists of four hardworking women. One of them is Benicia M. Ruiz, who is 56 and the owner of a store she started in 1992 where she sells dry goods. She also takes care of her eldest daughter, who has suffered from a variety of disabilities from a young age. At the moment, Benicia will invest her loan in the purchase of undergarments, shirts, blouses, trousers, and other items.

The other members of the group are Carla Vanessa M. Gómez, Katia Lucia R. Pérez, and Magali Margarita M. Rivas. Carla, age 26, is a young woman who began selling cosmetics and providing beauty services out of her home (manicures, pedicures, hair straightening, hair coloring, etc.). In 2009 she established a small beauty salon in her home, but now she has her own shop and wants to invest to maintain it. Katia R. is 31 years old and has a growing business selling undergarments and cosmetics. Magali M. is 25 years old and sells small articles of clothing.

loans.use: Purchase undergarments, shirts, blouses, trousers, and other items

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda A. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 47 years old, married, and has 5 children. Her eldest child is 28 years old while the youngest is 20. Minda is engaged in farming and a hog-raising business. Before, she only earned through farming. When she joined CEVI, a microfinance institution in the Philippines and a partner of KIVA, her income from farming improved and she was able to start her own piggery. She hopes to be able to manage both the farm and the piggery so she can earn more and provide for her family.

Minda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Napoleon Arnulfo

texts.es:
Napoleon de 57 años, tiene una tienda/panadería, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales)

Hace 25 años lo liquidaron de una empresa donde trabajaba aprovecho el dinero que le dio la empresa y compro víveres para ubicar una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, poco a poco con dedicación a podido surtir su tienda con una panadería. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am preparando panes hasta que termina y abre el negocio lo atiende hasta las 22h00pm. Cada pan lo vende a $ 0.07c/u, la libra de azúcar a $ 0.25, litro de leche a $ 0.85 etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar azúcar, arroz, harina para su tienda/panadería y así incrementar su capital de trabajo. En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y tener mas clientela.
texts.en:
Napoleon is 57 years old and manages a general store and bakery. He lives with his wife and four children in Guasmo de Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants.

Twenty-five years ago, the company that Napoleon worked for went out of business. He used the money from his severance pay to buy groceries and opened a small store in the front part of his house. With a little bit of dedication, he was able to stock his store and add a bakery. He currently works from 6am preparing bread and then opens his business and looks after it until 10pm. Each loaf of bread sells for $0.07/each, a pound of sugar for $0.25, and a liter of milk for $0.85.

Napoleon will use the loan to buy sugar, rice, and flour for both his store and bakery, thereby increasing his operating capital. In the future, he wants to grow his business and attract more customers.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, and flour

loans.name: Elizabeth Group

texts.es:
