El grupo Elizabeth está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Luz Marina Sánchez de 41 años quien se dedica al comercio de artesanías la cual en un principio vendía por unidad y hoy en día por docena. Ella es viuda y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales dos son menores están en primaria. 
Las otras integrantes son María Argelina García Sánchez de 36 años tiene una pequeña venta pollo, helados, choco bananos y   Leonor Elizabeth Blandón Pérez de 27 años venta de mercadería de ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Elizabeth Group consists of three hardworking individuals. One of them is Luz Marina Sánchez, age 41 and a craft merchant, who initially started selling individual units and now sells each day by the dozen. Luz is a widow with five children, two of whom are still minors and enrolled in elementary school.

The other members are María Argelina García Sánchez (age 36) who has a small business selling chicken, ice cream, and chocolate-covered bananas; and Leonor Elizabeth Blandón Pérez (age 27) who sells clothing and cosmetics.

loans.use: Purchase crafts to sell

loans.name: Bertha Feliciana

texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Communal Bank "Santiago the Patron Saint", which is located in the district of Santiago de Pupja, the province of Azángaro, an the department of Puno. She is 42 years old and married with four children. She studied until the 3rd grade.

Bertha has worked with Manuela Ramos for five years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, and was used to increase the capital of her business selling breads and pies. 

She is now asking for a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will use to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients she needs for her business. Her dream is to improve her business. The things Bertha likes most about the Communal Bank are the terms of the loan, the gains in her savings, and the focus on punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: To purchase consumables, such as bread, pies, and cheeses for her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 55 years old. Myrna is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Aside from raising pigs, she also helps her husband maintain their rice farm. She also helps sell the harvest to the market.

Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase 2 piglets, feed, and farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase 2 piglets, feed, and farm supplies.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 48 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 23 años posee una tienda de abarrotes, hace mucho años empezó en el negocio vendiendo de manera ambulante, pero hoy tiene un puesto de ventas dentro de un mercado cerca de su casa. Es así que atiende todas las mañanas a sus clientes y algunas horas después del almuerzo. Ella siempre esta pendiente de su negocio, por tanto procura mantenerla surtida de productos, eso hace que su negocio tenga estabilidad, permitiéndole a la vez sostener a su familia y no descuidar a sus hijos. Por el momento desea seguir trabajando en su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería. Es su crédito número 14 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, puesto que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería ya que se acercan  fechas importantes donde sus ventas aumentarán.
texts.en: Antonia is 48 years old and lives with her three children in their own home. For the last 23 years she has had a grocery store. Many years ago she started the business with travelling sales, but today she has a store in a market near her house.  This is how she tends to her customers every morning and for a few hours after lunch.  She is devoted to her business, so she manages to keep it stocked with products, which makes her business stable, allowing her to both support her family and not neglect her children. For the moment, she wants to keep working in her business acquiring more merchandise. This is her 14th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has a financial support. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her communal bank, because all its members are responsible people and very supportive. She is also grateful to all the people that will fund the loan she is seeking, since it will be very useful in the further development of her business. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of more merchandise, since important dates are coming up during which her sales will increase.

loans.use: To stock up on basic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct the second floor

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis de 63 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su esposa y dos hijos en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales)

Hace 15 años el comenzó con su tienda de víveres para poder mantener a su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 17 años, comprando de poco a poco productos de primera necesidad y vendiéndolos a un precio barato pudo adecuar el lugar para su tienda. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Vende arroz, azúcar, enlatados, aceite etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite para su pequeña tienda. En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Luis is 63 years old and has a small store in the front of his house. He lives with his wife and two kids in Guasmo de Guayaquil (an urban zone, in which the majority of inhabitants are informal merchants).

He began his convenience store business 15 years ago in order to be able to support his wife and two children, who are 10 and 17 years old. By purchasing, little by little, basic staple items and selling them at a low price he was able to set up his store. Currently he works from 06:00 am until 10:00 pm every day. He sells rice, sugar, canned goods, oil, etc.

With this loan he hopes to purchase rice, sugar, and oil for his small store. In the future, he would like to expand his store so that he can feel secure in his old age.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Nuestra Señora Del Valle - Sapallanga Group

texts.es:
Violeta, D. 32 años, es madre soltera con 2 hijos, es integrante D. la Alcancia comunal "Nuestra Señora del Valle - Sapallanga", Ella empezo a trabajar como mesera en un restaurante D. marisqueria, con los años fue adquiriendo experiencia ene le negocio D. venta D. comida. asi mismo trabajo como cocinera por un tiempo D. 5 años. Para luego tomar la decision que era momento D. abrir su porpio negocio D. venta comida, y así lo hizo y junto a una socia. lograron abrir un negocio D. venta D. comida el cuela va funcionando bien desD. hace ya 1 año. 

Con el crédito adquirido podra comprar insumos para aumentar la venta D. comida y poder incrementar sus ingresos, para D. este modo dar a mis hijos la comodidad que se merecen.
texts.en:
Violeta is 32 years of age, and is a single mother with 2 children. She is a member of the Nuestra Señora del Valle - Sapallanga Communal Bank. She started working as a waitress in a seafood restaurant, and then over a period of 5 years, gained experience working as a cook. After this, she decided it was time to open her own food business, and was able to do so together with a partner. It's been a year now, and business is good.  

With this loan, she plans to increase her supply of products, which will help her increase sales and bring in more income.  This will help her give her children all the comforts they deserve.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Julio C.tello Al Progreso Group

texts.es: Jessica es una D. las 8 integrantes D. la Alcancía comunal Julio C. Tello al Progreso, un nombre dedicado a la zona en donD. se ubican con sus viviendas y actividades económicas. A sus 24 años es conviviente y tiene un pequeño niño. Jessica se inicio en la venta D. bebidas diversas con la idea D. su hermana hace 3 años y se dedica a tiempo completo, ha logrado conjuntamente con su conyugue adquirir un trimovil el cual en la fecha es rentado para obtener otros ingresos, ha logrado mejorar su situación familiar en lo económico, ella desea hacer realidad la compra D. un terreno propio para poder construirlo y llegar a rentar habitaciones, ya que se ha dado cuenta que tienen demanda en la zona. El préstamo adquirido será invertido para ampliar su stock en bebidas y a la compra D. envases para su traslado D. los mismos. Jessica es una socia que participa activamente en su grupo hace 5 años y agradece se le otorgue la oportunidad D. ser una buena socia.
texts.en: Jessica is one of the 8 members of the Alcancia community bank Julio C. Tello al Progreso, (the name correlates to the area where the bank is located). Jessica is 24 years old, is married and has a small child. She began in business by selling various soft drinks, which was her sister's idea, and has now been in business for 3 years.  She manages the business, on a full-time basis, with her husband.  With this loan, she would like to buy a piece of land in order to build rooms for rent.  This is very much in demand in her part of town.  She would also like to invest some money into increasing her inventory of soft drinks and containers for shipping her drinks.  Jessica is a  member who actively participates in the group activities of this community bank and is grateful for the opportunity to be a good bank member.

loans.use: Comprar gaseosas (to purchase soft drinks)
